questions_en.feedback: It is best to check the oil level before you drive and/or if the engine has been turned off for a while and the oil is at rest, instead of still running through the pipes.

questions_en.question: Which of these symbols means: coolant?
questions_en.feedback: Symbol B means that something is wrong with the car's cooling system, or that the coolant needs to be refilled.

questions_en.question: Does the profile depth of a tyre have any effect on aquaplaning?
questions_en.feedback: The deeper the profile of the tyre, the smaller the chance for aquaplaning.

questions_en.question: Does a minimum profile depth have a positive effect on aquaplaning?
questions_en.feedback: Minimal profile depth makes the chance of aquaplaning occurring larger, which is a negative effect.

questions_en.question: You have an old car that originally doesn't have a right door mirror. You want to drive without this right door mirror, is that allowed?
questions_en.feedback: The inside mirror and the left door mirror are mandatory. You are allowed to drive without a right door mirror if it concerns a car built before 2010.

questions_en.question: You want to drive without a licence plate on your trailer, is that allowed?
questions_en.feedback: You are legally obligated to place a licence plate on the trailer.

questions_en.question: Do you always need to wear a seatbelt when driving in a car?
questions_en.feedback: It is always mandatory to wear a seatbelt in a car.

questions_en.question: Which head rest is set correctly?
questions_en.feedback: The head rest must be at equal height with your head, to offer protection when you, for example, need to brake suddenly.

questions_en.question: Is it advisable to turn off the airbag when a child shorter than 1.35 m is sitting in the front?
questions_en.feedback: It is not advisable to turn off the airbag when there are children in the passenger seat in the front, unless they are in a children's seat aimed forwards.

questions_en.question: A child is 2 years old. Do they need a children's seat?
questions_en.feedback: When a child is 2 years old, they are shorter than 1.35 m, which means that the child needs to be in an approved children's seat.

questions_en.question: A child is 1.50 metres and wearing a three-point belt, is this allowed?
questions_en.feedback: When the child is larger than 1.35 metres, they no longer need a child seat and the three-point belt is sufficient.

questions_en.question: Is it okay to transport your baby like this?
questions_en.feedback: No this is not allowed. Never transport a baby in your lap. You cannot guarantee the safety of the child in case of a collision. Always transport a baby in a suitable and approved child seat, fastened with a three-point belt.

questions_en.question: Do you need to wear a seatbelt as a passenger in a taxi?
questions_en.feedback: As a passenger in a taxi, you are always obligated to wear a three-point belt. Only the driver of the taxi is exempt when transporting paying passengers.

questions_en.question: Are you allowed to use a three-point belt as a hip belt (by wearing the diagonal part behind the back)?
questions_en.feedback: No, the diagonal part of the three-point belt needs to run in front of the body and over the shoulder.

questions_en.question: In what situation must you turn off the airbag?
questions_en.feedback: When you are transporting your baby against the driving direction, you need to turn off the airbag.

questions_en.question: Is a child allowed to wear a hip belt?
questions_en.feedback: A hip belt offers no support when, for example, you suddenly brake. A three-point belt is always mandatory.

questions_en.question: Is an airbag mandatory?
questions_en.feedback: Most new cars do have them.

questions_en.question: Is an adult allowed to wear a hip belt?
questions_en.feedback: A hip belt offers no support when, for example, you suddenly brake. This is not allowed: the three-point belt is mandatory.

questions_en.question: Do taxi drivers have to wear a belt?
questions_en.feedback: They only do not have this obligation when transporting paying passengers.

questions_en.question: Is a belt that shows fluff allowed?
questions_en.feedback: A belt that shows fluff is officially not damaged.

questions_en.question: A child is 1.35 metres and wearing a hip belt, is this allowed?
questions_en.feedback: A hip belt is not allowed, and when the child is shorter than 1.35 meter, they have to use an approved child seat or booster seat.

questions_en.question: Do you have to wear a seat belt in new touring cars, if they are present?
questions_en.feedback: If the belts are present, you are obligated to wear them

questions_en.question: Are you allowed to sit in a seat without a seat belt?
questions_en.feedback: You are always obligated to wear the seat belt when inside a vehicle. A spot is only an official seat if it has been fitted with a three-point belt.

questions_en.question: Does a company car also need seats with seat belts?
questions_en.feedback: A spot is only an official seat if it has been fitted with a three-point belt.

questions_en.question: You are transporting your baby in an approved car seat, placed in opposite direction to traffic and you turn off the airbag. Is this safe?
questions_en.feedback: When you turn off the airbag, you are allowed to transport your child like this.

questions_en.question: You are transporting your baby in an approved car seat, placed in the direction of traffic and you turn on the airbag. Is this safe?
questions_en.feedback: It is mortally dangerous to have the airbag turned on in this situation. The baby will often not survive the impact of the airbag. It is safe to transport the baby in this position, but the airbag needs to be turned of.

questions_en.question: Is a child below 12 years of age responsible for his own safety?
questions_en.feedback: Drivers are responsible for children below 12, to transport them safely.

questions_en.question: A child is larger than 1.35 metres and wearing a three-point belt, is this allowed?
questions_en.feedback: Wearing a three-point belt is mandatory. A child seat is no longer necessary, because the child is larger than 1.35 metres.

questions_en.question: A pregnant woman is wearing a three-point belt, is this wise?
questions_en.feedback: Even when someone is pregnant, they are obligated to wear a three-point belt. It is important to have the seat belt run under the belly

questions_en.question: Is a child allowed to be in the back seat without a seatbelt when there are 2 adults in the front?
questions_en.feedback: A child must always wear a seatbelt, even when there are adults present.

questions_en.question: Do you need to turn off the engine when you are in a standing-still traffic jam?
questions_en.feedback: It is better for the environment, and it saves on fuel, if you turn off the engine during a visible stop that takes longer than 20 seconds. For example, at an open bridge or railway crossing.

questions_en.question: You are waiting at a railway crossing. Do you turn off the engine?
questions_en.feedback: It usually takes a while before the train passes and the track is released again. With a stop of 20 seconds or more, it will already be more efficient and therefore better for te environment to turn of the engine.

questions_en.question: What is a safe time to have between you and the car in front of you?
questions_en.feedback: A safe following distance is at least 2 seconds. How much that is in metres, depends on the speed you have at that moment. The rule of thumb is the speed divided by two, plus 10%.

questions_en.question: When are you driving defensively?
questions_en.feedback: When driving defensively, you take mistakes others could make into account and keep an eye on your own behaviour!
options: If I am anticipating the mistakes of others
If I use the mistakes of others

questions_en.question: What saves the most fuel when driving?
questions_en.feedback: By driving with the cruise control on, you maintain a constant speed. This saves fuel, because you aren't braking or using the accelerator.
options: Driving with the cruise control turned on
Driving with the airconditioning turned on

questions_en.question: This symbol appears on your dashboard. The colour is red. What is the best thing to do now?
questions_en.feedback: If the symbol glows red, the best thing is to stop as soon as possible (if that doesn't happen by itself).
options: Go to the garage and have it checked

questions_en.question: What uses the most fuel when driving?
questions_en.feedback: Air-conditioning uses a lot of fuel.
options: Driving with the air-conditioning turned on
Driving with the cruise control turned on

questions_en.question: Your tyre pressure is too low, when do you use more fuel?
questions_en.feedback: When your tyre pressure is incorrect, you always use more fuel, because your road holding is not optimal.

questions_en.question: Is it good for the environment to let the engine get warm in the winter?
questions_en.feedback: It is not good for the environment to have the engine get warm first, you are better off starting the car and driving off slowly, which also saves on fuel.

questions_en.question: How can you save fuel?
questions_en.feedback: By switching gears at low revolutions, your revolutions stay low constantly, which makes you use less fuel in comparison to driving at high revolutions.
options: Switching gears at a low revolution
Switching gears at a high revolution

questions_en.question: Do you save fuel if you brake late and accelerate quickly?
questions_en.feedback: To save fuel, it is better to anticipate what is going to come so you can release the accelerator early and subsequently slowly increase the speed again.

questions_en.question: How can you prevent traffic jams as a result of phantom traffic jams?
questions_en.feedback: A phantom traffic jam can occur because the person in front of you brakes, the person behind them breaks harder, etc. The traffic behind them needs to brake as well because of that. This traffic jam can move They often occur in tunnels.
options: Keep your distance and brake gradually
You can't do anything to prevent it

questions_en.question: If you have to wait in your car for half a minute, do you turn off the engine?
questions_en.feedback: When you have to wait for a long time, it is wiser to turn off the engine. That way you save fuel, and it is also better for the environment.

questions_en.question: You have a skibox on top of your car, are you using more fuel?
questions_en.feedback: Your car is heavier and less aerodynamic, causing it to use more fuel than when driving without a skibox.

questions_en.question: When do you save the least fuel?
questions_en.feedback: By driving fast and switching gears late, you drive at high revolution and therefore use a lot of fuel. Note: if you save the least, you use the most.
options: If you drive fast and switch gears late
If you drive fast and switch gears early
If you drive calmly and switch gears early

questions_en.question: When do you save the most fuel?
questions_en.feedback: By driving calmly and switching gears early, you keep the revolutions low and therefore use the least fuel.
options: If you drive calmly and switch gears early
If you drive fast and switch gears early
If you drive fast and switch gears late

questions_en.question: When do you save the most fuel?
questions_en.feedback: Letting the engine get warm before driving away does not save any fuel, it only wastes fuel.
options: When you drive away immediately after starting the car
When you start the engine and let the engine get warm for several minutes before driving away

questions_en.question: Wat is het gevolg van een lage bandenspanning?
questions_en.feedback: Door een te lage bandenspanning ontstaat er meer weerstand tussen de banden en het wegdek, waardoor het brandstofverbruik hoger ligt.

questions_en.question: Do new car tyres need an EU tyre label?
questions_en.feedback: New car tyres need to be equipped with a tyre label since November 2012, so it is easily visible if the tyres are economical and safe.

questions_en.question: What does a red energy label mean?
questions_en.feedback: An energy label indicates how economically a car drives, where red is not and green is economical.
options: The car does not drive economically

questions_en.question: Is anticipating generally beneficial for fuel consumption?
questions_en.feedback: By anticipating you can often let go of the accelerator early and calmly increase your speed again, instead of braking hard at the last moment, then driving away fast. That saves on fuel.

questions_en.question: When is the novice driving licence invalidated?
questions_en.feedback: If you refuse to cooperate with the alcohol test your driving licence is immediately declared invalid. For answer B and C, you are first suspended and have to do a test at the CBR. If you fail the test the licence is invalidated and the driving exam will have to be taken again.
options: If you refuse to cooperate in the alcohol test
If you ran a red light more than 3 times in 5 years
If you drove more than 50 km/h over the speed limit

questions_en.question: Is the effect of medicine always noticeable?
questions_en.feedback: If you feel sleepy or have trouble concentrating, poor visibility; or feel dizzy, it is better if you do not drive a car. Sometimes the medicine can make you irritable or indifferent. Furthermore, medicine can cause you to have less control over arm and leg muscles. If you are in doubt, consult your doctor or apothecary. In some cases it is possible to switch to a different medicine that has less effect on your driving ability.

questions_en.question: What is the average reaction time of a human?
questions_en.feedback: If someone is not tired or distracted, their reaction time is 1 second on average.

questions_en.question: How much alcohol is allowed in a novice driver?
Which of the following will you receive from the CBR when you had to much alcohol (ca. 0.8 promille) while driving?
questions_en.feedback: If you are busted with 0.8 promille alcohol in your blood while driving, you are obligated to follow a course. For experienced drivers, this means an LEMA course, novice drivers can also be obligated to follow an EMA instead of a LEMA.

questions_en.question: How long can the police detain you when driving under the influence of alcohol?
questions_en.feedback: The police can detain you for 6 hours when you are caught driving under the influence.

questions_en.question: What can you do to get the alcohol out of your blood faster?
questions_en.feedback: There is nothing you can do to get the alcohol out of your blood faster. So, pay close attention to the alcohol limit.

questions_en.question: How long does it take before you are sober again after you've drank 5 glasses of alcohol?
questions_en.feedback: It takes around 1.5 hours for your body to process one glass of alcohol. When drinking five glass, it takes 1.5 x 5 = 7.5 hours before your body has processed all the alcohol and you are sober again.

questions_en.question: How long does it take for 1 glass of alcohol to be broken down in your blood?
questions_en.feedback: It takes an average of 1.5 hours before a glass of alcohol disappears from your blood.

questions_en.question: What influence does fatigue have on the driver's concentration?
questions_en.feedback: Fatigue has a negative effect on you when you are behind the wheel. It is important to see if you can still drive.

questions_en.question: Does a novice driver commit a criminal offence when they drive a motor vehicle with a breath alcohol level of more than 0.2 promille?
questions_en.feedback: A breath alcohol level higher than 0.2 promille is seen as a criminal offence for a novice driver.

questions_en.question: Your driving licence was invalidated, what can you do?
questions_en.feedback: When your driving licence is invalidated, you no longer have a driving licence, which means you need to get your driving licence again, so take driving lessons.
options: You cannot take driving lessons or drive

questions_en.question: The police has suspended your driving licence. What vehicles are you allowed to use now?
questions_en.feedback: You can use a bicycle because you do not need a valid driving licence to do so.

questions_en.question: Can the police demand you get tested if they suspect you used drugs and/or alcohol?
questions_en.feedback: When the police suspect you used a suspect 'substance', they are allowed to stop you, just like with alcohol use.

questions_en.question: From what percentage can they retain your driving licence?
questions_en.feedback: A novice driving licence can be immediately retained from 0.8 promille.

questions_en.question: What is the maximum allowed limit that an experience driver can have in their blood?
What is the maximum allowed limit that a novice driver can have in their blood?
When are you an experienced driver?
questions_en.feedback: In principle, you are an experienced driver once you have your driving licence for more than 5 years. But, if you obtained your driving licence before your 18th birthday, you are only an experienced driver after 7 years.
options: If you have your driving licence more than 5 years
If you have your driving licence more than 2 years
If you have your driving licence more than 1 years

questions_en.question: What can you compare the feeling of extreme fatigue with?
questions_en.feedback: If you haven't slept in a long time, this can be compared to the same feeling as alcohol. Your capability to react decreases.

questions_en.question: What do you need to follow if you have drank to much alcohol (0.8 promille) as a novice driver, and the police stops you?
questions_en.feedback: If you, as a novice driver, are caught driving with more than 0.8 promille alcohol in your blood, you are obligated to follow an EMA (Educatieve Maatregel Alcohol).

questions_en.question: What do you need to follow if you have drank to much alcohol (between 0.8 and 1.0 promille) as an experienced driver, and the police stops you?
questions_en.feedback: If you, as an experienced driver, are caught driving with more than 0.8 and 1.0 promille alcohol in your blood, you are obligated to follow a LEMA (Lichte Educatieve Maatregel Alcohol).

questions_en.question: Can an insurance company charge you for costs if it turns out you caused an accident under the influence of alcohol?
questions_en.feedback: If you caused an accident while under the influence, you are generally not insured.

questions_en.question: Are you under the influence after drinking a Bacardi Breezer?
questions_en.feedback: After a sip of alcohol, you are under the influence. It doesn't matter what kind of drink it is.

questions_en.question: What happens if you smoke a joint before driving?
questions_en.feedback: Smoking a joint has a negative effect on your responsiveness. Even though some might say it has no effect or a calming effect on them, the most important thing for you to know is that your responsiveness is impaired, which can be dangerous.
options: Your reaction capabilities decrease, just like with alcohol
You become more calm and less aggressive
A joint has no effect on my driving behaviour

questions_en.question: Are there drugs or medicine that influence your driving skills?
questions_en.feedback: There are many drugs and medicines that could influence your driving capability.

questions_en.question: Because it is calm on the road, you can really keep driving. You drive 3 hours without a break. Is this wise?
questions_en.feedback: It is wise to take a fifteen minute break after every 2 hours of driving. During a 3 hour drive, it is wise to take at least 1 break.

questions_en.question: If you drank alcohol, you can get ...?
questions_en.feedback: If you drank alcohol, you can get the tunnel effect. This is caused by the sedating influence of alcohol. Furthermore, your field of vision will decrease.

questions_en.question: Does a standard glass of beer contain as much alcohol as a standard glass of whisky?
questions_en.feedback: The idea here is that a drink with a higher alcohol percentage is served in a smaller glass than a drink with a lower percentage. A glass of beer, therefore, is larger than a glass of whisky. That way, you drink the same amount of alcohol in absolute terms.

questions_en.question: when does alcohol start influencing your driving style?
questions_en.feedback: From the first sip of alcohol, and therefore the lowest percentage, your driving style is already influenced.

questions_en.question: You are 20 years old. What is the maximum allowed alcohol level in your blood?
questions_en.feedback: If you are 20 years old, you are without a doubt still a novice driver, meaning that the maximum allowed alcohol level in your blood is 0.2 promille.

questions_en.question: Your speedometer is broken. Are you allowed to drive like this?
questions_en.feedback: It is illegal to drive without a working speedometer. It is important to always be able to see how fast you're driving.

questions_en.question: What is the danger of cruise control?
questions_en.feedback: Because the car keeps driving automatically, you need to perform less physical action and you could get distracted. Never think you can go do other things because the car will keep driving by itself, you always need to be focused on traffic.
options: You could start driving too fast
You could start driving too slow

questions_en.question: Which of the following items have an effect on the stopping distance?
questions_en.feedback: The stopping distance is the sum of the reaction time of the driver and the braking distance.

questions_en.question: You are driving 50 km/h. How many metres is the braking distance?
What lane has the most grooving?
questions_en.feedback: The right lane has the most grooving, because that is where most vehicles drive. Furthermore, by far most trucks drive there, which have the biggest hand in forming grooves in the asphalt.

questions_en.question: You are driving in the rain. Which tyre gives you the least chance on aquaplaning?
questions_en.feedback: Winter tyres give you the smallest chance on aquaplaning, because those tyres have the deepest profile which helps them drain the water most effectively so no layer of water remains between the tyre and the road surface.

questions_en.question: What influences the braking distance?
questions_en.feedback: All these factors influence the braking distance.
options: Road surface, tyre profile and quality of the brakes
The road surface and the tyre profile

questions_en.question: Your tyre pressure is too low. Does this cause the tyres to wear faster?
questions_en.feedback: There is a special part on the tyre designed to touch the surface. With tyres that are too soft, the right part does not touch the surface and quickly wears off.

questions_en.question: You are driving 50 km/h and 50 metres away from the traffic lights. The traffic lights suddenly turn yellow. What do you do?
questions_en.feedback: If you are driving 50 km/h, the stopping distance is 26.25 metres. Therefore, you have ample distance to stop.
options: I let go of the accelerator and brake gently
I abruptly brake for the yellow light.

questions_en.question: You are driving 50 km/h. How many metres is the reaction distance?
questions_en.feedback: To calculate the reaction distance, you can calculate the following sum: (speed/4)+10%. So, that is 50/4=12,5 ? 12,5+10%= 13,75. Then you choose the closest answer, which is 14 metres.

questions_en.question: You are driving 50 km/h. How many metres is the braking distance?
You are driving 50 km/h. How many metres is the stopping distance?
questions_en.feedback: To calculate the stopping distance, you add the reaction distance to the braking distance. The reaction distance with a speed of 50 km/h is 13.75 m. The braking distance with a speed of 50 km/h is 12.5 m. 13,75+12,5= 26,25 metres.

questions_en.question: Your brake does not work very well. Can this make the braking distance longer?
questions_en.feedback: If a vehicle's brake is not working well, it takes longer before you can bring your vehicle to a complete stop.

questions_en.question: Your brake does not work very well. Does that have an influence on the reaction distance?
questions_en.feedback: A brake that doesn't work well has no influence on your reaction distance. It does have influence on the braking and stopping distance.

questions_en.question: The pressure in the tyres is not correct. Is there a larger danger of slipping now?
questions_en.feedback: When the tyres do not have the correct pressure, there is a higher chance of slipping.

questions_en.question: What tyres lower the risk of aquaplaning?
questions_en.feedback: Winter tyres have the deepest profile, which lets them drain the most water, ensuring that grip with the road surface can be maintained longer.

questions_en.question: Everyone is driving at the same speed in a traffic jam. How can you ensure that the traffic keeps moving?
questions_en.feedback: If you are driving in a traffic jam, it is best for the flow of traffic to stay in the same lane. This way, other participants in traffic do not constantly have to decelerate to make room for other entering traffic, and a calm tempo can usually be maintained.

questions_en.question: Is it wise to turn on your warning lights when approaching a traffic jam?
questions_en.feedback: Yes, if you have to brake significantly, you can let the traffic behind you know through your warning lights. That way they know that there is significant braking in front of them, and can act accordingly.

questions_en.question: Is it likely you'll make more mistakes as a novice driver?
questions_en.feedback: Yes, it is likely you'll make more mistakes as a novice driver. As you gain more experience in traffic, you'll be able to judge situations better and react faster.

questions_en.question: A matrix sign indicates a lower speed. Can you expect a traffic jam/
questions_en.feedback: When approaching an electronic sign/ matrix sign with a maximum speed, you can assume that you are approaching a dangerous situation.

questions_en.question: Do you always give priority to emergency vehicles?
questions_en.feedback: You must always give priority to emergency vehicles. Note! A vehicle with, for example, only its flashing lights on is not an 'emergency vehicle'. Emergency vehicles always have the flashing lights and siren on.

questions_en.question: For which people do you need to be extra attentive?
questions_en.feedback: Children and the elderly as seen as more vulnerable in traffic, because they are unpredictable. Pay extra attention.

questions_en.question: Is defensive driving behaviour desirable?
questions_en.feedback: Defensive driving behaviour means taking the mistakes other traffic participants could make into account, and anticipating on those mistakes.

questions_en.question: What following distance do you maintain at 60 km/h?
questions_en.feedback: With a speed of 60 km/h, you need to keep at least 33 m distance between you and the person in front of you. The sum is as follows: (60/2)+10%=33.

questions_en.question: The matrix signs light up and say '50'. You drive on an autoweg where you can go 100 km/h. What do you do?
questions_en.feedback: The lowest indicated speed must be followed. This often indicates that something is changing in the traffic situation. It is not wise to abruptly brake in such a situation, as you could surprise the other traffic.
options: You decrease your speed to 50 km/h
You keep driving 100 km/h, since there is no visible danger

questions_en.question: Where can you expect a brommobiel on the road?
questions_en.feedback: A brommobiel may drive within and outside of the built-up area, it is only not allowed on motorways or autoweg.

questions_en.question: What following distance do you minimally keep at 90 km/h?
questions_en.feedback: To calculate the minimum following distance, you can calculate the following sum: (speed/2)+10%. So, with a speed of 90 km/h, the minimum following distance is 90/2=45 ? 45+10%=49,5. Then you choose the answer closest to the result of the sum, which is 50 metres.

questions_en.question: What is the minimum following distance you keep when driving 120 km/h?
questions_en.feedback: To calculate the minimum following distance, you can calculate the following sum: (speed/2)+10%. So, with a speed of 120 km/h, the minimum following distance is 120/2=60 ? 60+10%=66.

questions_en.question: What following distance do you minimally keep at 30 km/h?
questions_en.feedback: To calculate the minimum following distance, you can calculate the following sum: (speed/2)+10%. So, with a speed of 30 km/h, the minimum following distance is 30/2=15 ? 15+10%=16,5. Then you choose the answer closest to the result of the sum, which is 15 metres.

questions_en.question: What decides the minimum following distance?
questions_en.feedback: They tyre brand and length of the vehicle have, in general, nothing to do with the minimum following distance. The weather conditions do, because they influence, for example, the grip on the road surface and your vision, which can make your stopping distance longer.

questions_en.question: The driver suddenly wants to go right, how do you react?
questions_en.feedback: If you can solve it without braking abruptly, that is the better solution. When braking abruptly, traffic from behind can hit your vehicle.
options: You evade if that is necessary and possible, and use the horn to warn the driver.
You brake abruptly so you don't get hit by the driver.

questions_en.question: Can you shorting the braking distance by anticipating?
questions_en.feedback: By anticipating you can shorten your reaction distance, but the braking distance depends on things like the weather conditions and state of the vehicle.

questions_en.question: Is risk compensation dangerous?
questions_en.feedback: Risk compensation means that people, as they aware of more taken safety measures, are likely to take more risks. An example is driving through turns fast, since you are wearing a seatbelt anyway.

questions_en.question: On what side of the road do you find these?
questions_en.feedback: The white reflector is found on the left side of the road. (or on the backside on the right side). The reflector poles always have two sides. The rule is Red = Right!
options: On the left side of the road
On the right side of the road

questions_en.question: Is een negatieve wegverkanting voordelig voor het onder controle houden van jouw voertuig?
questions_en.feedback: Een negatieve wegverkanting is niet voordelig voor jouw controle over het voertuig. Dit heeft te maken met de grip van het voertuig en hoe die over de ondergrond verdeeld is.

questions_en.question: A car wants to exit an exit and turn left, you arrive from the other road user's left and want to enter that same exit. Who has priority?
questions_en.feedback: The person on the exit needs to give priority, but for the flow of traffic it is often better to first let them exit. That makes communication very important.

questions_en.question: When is it desirable to turn on your low beam lights during the day?
questions_en.feedback: It is always desirable to drive with the low beam lights on, even if circumstances do not specifically require it.

questions_en.question: Which road users is this sign meant for?
questions_en.feedback: There is a warning for cross winds. This can have an effect on everyone using the road, for example because you are blown off-course by a strong wind.

questions_en.question: On what road do most accidents happen?
questions_en.feedback: On an 80-km road, in comparison to the autoweg and motorway, most accidents happen. This is, among other things, attributable to narrower roads, the dangers of overtaking other drivers, and the different speeds of vehicles.

questions_en.question: You come from the forest and are driving on a sand road, and want to then enter the roadway. Who has priority?
questions_en.feedback: In case you are driving on an unpaved road and want to enter the paved road, drivers on the paved road always have priority, even if they are not coming from the right. Note! This does not apply to pedestrians.
options: The person coming from the right

questions_en.question: Which saying is most true about the foliage along the road?
questions_en.feedback: Because light is constantly coming through the trees, your eyes need to continually adapt to the intensity of the light This is difficult, and because of the quick changes from shadow to sunlight your vision gets worse.
options: Sunlight comes through the trees, making your vision worse
Sunlight comes through the trees, making your vision better
Sunlight comes through the trees, it has no influence on your sight

questions_en.question: You are driving on a road with many trees on the side of the road. What do you need to pay attention to?
questions_en.feedback: Because there are trees along the road, you cannot move onto the verge if this is necessary.
options: I need to be extra careful, except on an intersection
Drivers on side streets cannot see me

questions_en.question: What could happen if it suddenly starts raining a lot after a long dry period?
questions_en.feedback: Vehicles have leaked rubber and oil residue on a dry road surface. When it suddenly starts to rain, it will get slippery.
options: Because of the rain on a dry road surface, I will sooner experience aquaplaning
The rain is taken up in the road surface quicker
Rubber and oil residue make the road surface slippery

questions_en.question: Where does aquaplaning occur more often?
questions_en.feedback: Generally, people drive slowly on the exit lane The roadway is used more than the exit lane.

questions_en.question: you have engine problems. Is this a safe place to wait as a person?
questions_en.feedback: For safety, it's advisable to wait behind the crash barrier, if you are on the emergency lane.

questions_en.question: Your car broke down. Is this a safe place to wait as a person?
questions_en.feedback: The emergency lane is a dangerous place to wait. The crash barrier can protect you if, for example, another driver ends up in the emergency lane.

questions_en.question: It is advisable to turn on your lights on a road. Which lights?
questions_en.feedback: Low beam lights are advisable on any road, to increase your visibility.

questions_en.question: On which lane is the chance of aquaplaning the highest?
questions_en.feedback: Because of grooving on lane C, these groove are filled with water. This makes the risk of aquaplaning higher.

questions_en.question: Is a brommobiel allowed to drive here?
questions_en.feedback: The C9 sign is a closure to all motor vehicles. A brommobiel is also a motor vehicle. The road where the sign C12 is placed, is closed to cyclists, mopeds, handicapped vehicles and for riders, livestock, wagons, motor vehicles that cannot or may not go faster than 25 km/h.

questions_en.question: Is a brommobiel allowed to drive here?
questions_en.feedback: The C8 sign indicates a closure to all motor vehicles that cannot or may not drive faster than 25 km/h. A brommobiel may go 45 km/h and is therefore not included in this group. The C15 sign indicates a closure to handicapped vehicles, bicycles and mopeds. This also does not include the brommobiel.

questions_en.question: You are driving on a one-way street. Both sides have parked cars. What do you need to take into account?
questions_en.feedback: You should expect that pedestrians might cross without first looking left or right to see if anything is coming.
options: Pedestrians cannot see me because they only look left
Pedestrians cannot see me because they only look right

questions_en.question: On what side of the road do you find these?
questions_en.feedback: Red reflectors are found on the right side of the road and white reflectors are on the left side of the road. Mnemonic device: Red=Right.
options: On the right side of the road
On the left side of the road

questions_en.question: It has started freezing. Where is there more danger of slipping?
questions_en.feedback: The road surface is extra cold on top of overpasses and bridges, because the cold comes from both above and beneath. This makes the road surface slippery sooner in those places.
options: On top of overpasses and bridges

questions_en.question: When can aquaplaning take place?
questions_en.feedback: Motivation: Aquaplaning only has to do with rain and therefore does not happen when it snows.

questions_en.question: What is the largest reason for accidents on a motorcycle?
questions_en.feedback: The biggest cause is a collision with a car on an intersection. For example, when the traffic light for the motorcycle turns green and somewhere else on that intersection a car barely missed the yellow light and therefore runs a red light, a collision is often inevitable. This is a greater risk for motorcyclists than for cars, because motorcycles can often accelerate very quickly, thereby finding themselves on the intersection at the same time as the 'red runner'.
options: You collide with a car on an intersection.
You go off the road in a turn because of excessive speed.
You lose control over the vehicle because of a slippery road surface

questions_en.question: An accident occurred and there are injured. Can you give the victim a glass of water?
questions_en.feedback: You cannot let the victim drink or eat anything. This can go wrong because of internal injuries and worsen the situation. Wait for the emergency services, they can ascertain if the victim can drink something.

questions_en.question: If needed, how do you position the victim?
questions_en.feedback: The recovery position is the safest. This way, the victim cannot swallow their tongue or, if they have to throw up, their air pipe won't be blocked (danger of suffocation).

questions_en.question: The cyclist is bleeding severely. Do you use your jacket to stop the bleeding?
questions_en.feedback:
Leave the victim lying down in case of severe blood loss.
If possible, bring the wounded body part up.
Immediately press a bleeding wound closed, for at least ten minutes.
Apply pressure directly to the wound.
Do not remove objects sticking from the wound.
Apply pressure on the wound on both sides of the object.

questions_en.question: Whose identity must be known, before they may leave the site of an accident?
questions_en.feedback: The identity of all involved in the accident must be known. Taking care of the incident through insurance and/or police must be possible, which is not possible without knowledge of everyone's identities.
options: The person who caused the accident

questions_en.question: Do you need to stay with the victim if no other people are present?
questions_en.feedback: If you are the only person with the victim, you are obligated to stay until the emergency services arrive. You may not just abandon a victim.

questions_en.question: You are towing a motorcycle, is that allowed?
questions_en.feedback: It is not. To tow a vehicle, it needs to be able to balance itself on the road. A motorcycle with sidecar is allowed, as long as the wheel of the sidecar is braked.

questions_en.question: How high is the accident percentage of human errors?
questions_en.feedback: 92% of accidents are caused by human errors. A moment of nonchalance or incompetence can be the cause. The other 8% are caused by, for example, technical failures or a tree that fell on the road.

questions_en.question: What is the procedure after an accident?
questions_en.feedback: You first ensure the safety of yourself and the victim, then you call 112. Never drag the victim to a different spot.
options: You first ensure the safety of yourself and the victim
You drag the victim to the side of the road in order to ensure their safety

questions_en.question: When can you expect (crossing) animals?
questions_en.feedback: After sundown (at night) you can expect animals on the road

questions_en.question: You are in the water with your car. Is it a good idea to turn off the contact?
questions_en.feedback: When you disable the contact, the lights will also turn off. The lights will actually be usefull for help to find you. Also, the electronic windows will be inoperable.

questions_en.question: What is the best thing to do if you end up in the water with the car?
questions_en.feedback: You first turn on the lights so that the place of the vehicle is and stays clear for emergency services, then you try to open or break the windows.

questions_en.question: When are you allowed to use the emergency lane?
questions_en.feedback: When the rush-hour lane is opened, you may use the emergency lane, because it counts as a rush-hour lane at that moment.
options: When it is used as a rush-hour lane
If an emergency vehicle is approaching

questions_en.question: Na een ongeval is het been van de fietser ontwricht. Zet je het been recht?
questions_en.feedback: Dit laat je over aan de hulpdiensten.

questions_en.question: A driver has a pain in his neck after a collision. What is generally the wisest thing to do?
questions_en.feedback: You do not know what happened to the driver. That is why it is best to leave the driver sitting while you wait for the emergency services to arrive.
options: You leave the driver in the car
You take the driver out of the car and lay him down flat

questions_en.question: You are having engine problems and place the hazard triangle 5 metres away from the car. Is this allowed?
questions_en.feedback: You must place the hazard triangle at least 30 metres away from the car.

questions_en.question: You are towing a motorcycle with sidecar, is this allowed?
questions_en.feedback: A vehicle with more than 2 wheels may be towed.

questions_en.question: What percentage of accidents is caused by fatigue?
questions_en.feedback: Around 15% of traffic incidents is caused because drivers are very tired and therefore not able to react in time.

questions_en.question: Are you allowed to drive away after an accident?
questions_en.feedback: You are not allowed to simply drive away after an accident. The identity of the victim and guilty party must first be known. You may also not abandon someone who got hurt.

questions_en.question: The victim requests you take of their helmet, is that allowed?
questions_en.feedback: You do not know what happened to, for example, the neck of the victim. That is why you leave the helm on: you wait for professional help to arrive.

questions_en.question: Young drivers are more often involved in an accident. What is the reason for that?
questions_en.feedback: Young drivers do not have enough experience in traffic yet and are prone to underestimating situations.
options: They often underestimate risks in traffic

questions_en.question: What medication can influence driving ability?
questions_en.feedback: Medicine with a yellow sticker can influence driving ability, so pay extra attention when taking medicine with a yellow sticker on the package.
options: All medicine available in the pharmacy

questions_en.question: What is the phone number for emergency car in the Netherlands?
questions_en.feedback: In an emergency situation, you call 112. B is the national service number for the police.

questions_en.question: You come from point A. When do you indicate your direction if you want to go straight?
questions_en.feedback: You indicate your direction at point C. When you indicate your direction at point B, people will think you want to take the first right.

questions_en.question: The driver on the left does not give you priority. Do you still cross the intersection?
questions_en.feedback: If you have priority, but don't get it, it is your task to prevent an accident. Even if you actually have priority and traffic pushes in, that doesn't mean that you are now allowed to drive into someone. The other driver needs to give priority, you cannot take it.

questions_en.question: You are driving on an intersection without any designated priorities. Who has priority?
questions_en.feedback: The general rule is that drivers from the right have priority. Pedestrians are not drivers and therefore not included in this basic rule.

questions_en.question: You want to turn right on the roundabout. Do you need to let the pedestrian, who wants to go straight, go first?
questions_en.feedback: In this case, the pedestrian wants to go straight on the same road you are driving on. You therefore have to let the pedestrian go first.

questions_en.question: Are you allowed to turn right here?
questions_en.feedback: The bottom sign is a mandatory direction. The sign above indicates that you have priority over the right side street.

questions_en.question: What kind of roundabout are you approaching here?
questions_en.feedback: The roundabout is divided over multiple lanes.

questions_en.question: Are you allowed to park on a priority road within a built-up area?
questions_en.feedback: This is allowed in principle. Note! If you cause danger or hindrance, it is forbidden. It is forbidden to park on a priority road outside of the built-up area, although you may park in the grassy verge, unless otherwise specified.

questions_en.question: Who has priority?
questions_en.feedback: A rider is in the category drivers and the rule goes: a driver on a paved road has priority over a driver on an unpaved road.

questions_en.question: Does this sign mean 'dangerous intersection'?
questions_en.feedback: This sign means 'priority intersection'.

questions_en.question: You stop here to let someone get into the car, is that allowed?
questions_en.feedback: No, you are not allowed to stand still directly before or after an intersection.

questions_en.question: Are you allowed to indicate you want to turn left before you enter a roundabout?
questions_en.feedback: You are allowed to indicate you want to turn left before you enter a roundabout, this is extra clear for the other traffic.

questions_en.question: Where are you?
questions_en.feedback: When the priority sign is placed in front of the intersection, you are within the built-up area.

questions_en.question: Where are you?
questions_en.feedback: When the priority sign is placed after the intersection, you are outside the built-up area.

questions_en.question: Is a priority road always a road that goes straight?
questions_en.feedback: There are priority roads that bear to one side.

questions_en.question: You want to turn right. Do you need to let the cyclist go first?
questions_en.feedback: The cyclist is going straight, you are turning right. The cyclist has priority.

questions_en.question: You want to follow the road to the left. Do you need to give the motorcycle priority?
questions_en.feedback: Even if the road bears to the left, it is still a priority road. You have priority over the motorcycle.

questions_en.question: What is the foremost cause for accidents on the road?
questions_en.feedback: Drivers are not well aware of the rules, which is why many accidents happen.
options: Drivers are unfamiliar with the priority rules

questions_en.question: You want to turn left. Do you need to give the other car priority?
questions_en.feedback: Regardless of it being a customs car, he is going straight. You can never turn left in front of oncoming traffic.

questions_en.question: Which of the below generally has a positive road cant?
questions_en.feedback: A roundabout has a negative road cant.

questions_en.question: You are approaching a roundabout and overtaken on the right. Is this allowed?
questions_en.feedback: Just before or on a roundabout, you are allowed to overtake on the right.

questions_en.question: Are you allowed to park 2 metres before an intersection?
questions_en.feedback: You are not allowed to park within 5 metres of an intersection.

questions_en.question: You are approaching an intersection without designated priorities, and want to turn. You see a cyclist driving next to you. He wants to go straight. Do you need to give him priority?
questions_en.feedback: Straight on the same road has priority, so you need to give priority to the cyclist.

questions_en.question: Mag je parkeren op een voorrangsweg buiten de bebouwde kom?
questions_en.feedback: Buiten de bebouwde kom mag je niet parkeren op een voorrangsweg. Je mag wel in de berm parkeren, tenzij anders aangegeven.

questions_en.question: You want to turn left. Do you need to give priority to the cyclist?
questions_en.feedback: You need to give priority to the cyclist. After all, the cyclist is going straight on the same road as you are. This still concerns the same road, even if you are not on the same piece of road, because it is a bicycle path.

questions_en.question: If my mirror is set correctly, there is no blind spot. Is this correct?
questions_en.feedback: You can set a mirror to minimise the blind spot as much as possible. But you can never make the blind spot disappear completely.

questions_en.question: Who goes first?
questions_en.feedback: You and the tram are equal in this situation when it comes to traffic signs. In that case, the tram always goes first.

questions_en.question: You want to turn right. Do you need to give priority to the cyclist?
questions_en.feedback: You both want to turn into the same road. You have the short turn and the cyclist has the long turn. Short turn goes before long turn, so you do not need to give priority to the cyclist.

questions_en.question: What is the biggest 'blind spot' for a truck?
questions_en.feedback: The driver can make the blind spots on the left and right of the truck smaller by looking into his mirror from a different angle. The truck driver can never see behind the truck.

questions_en.question: You want to go left here, do you need to indicate your turn?
questions_en.feedback: You always have to indicate a turn when you want to turn, to inform the other traffic.

questions_en.question: You want to stay in this lane. What is wise to do?
questions_en.feedback: You indicate direction, so that it is clear you will stay on the exit and do not want to enter the roadway.
options: You indicate your direction, so that other drivers know what you are planning to do
You do not indicate your direction, because you do not want to change lanes

questions_en.question: You want to turn. When do you release the gas?
questions_en.feedback: You release the gas before you enter the turn, you will need to take it at an appropriate speed.

questions_en.question: Can you already start accelerating in the turn?
questions_en.feedback: You can already start accelerating in the turn, as long as you maintain the correct speed.

questions_en.question: Who has priority?
questions_en.feedback: The car is going straight on the same road, which is why it has priority.

questions_en.question: What should you pay most attention to before taking a turn?
questions_en.feedback: Always focus on the sharpness and clarity of the turn, this is more important than the speed you can take the turn at.
options: How sharp and clear the turn is
The maximum speed you can take the turn at, so you can drive fast.

questions_en.question: You want to turn. When do you switch gears?
questions_en.feedback: You already switch gears before the turn. This also helps decelerating so you can take the turn in a safer way.

questions_en.question: Are there turns you can take in the 4th gear?
questions_en.feedback: There are often turns on the motorway that are very wide. You can easily take these in the 4th gear.

questions_en.question: You gear down while in a turn. Is this correct?
questions_en.feedback: You always gear down before you take a turn.

questions_en.question: Who goes first?
questions_en.feedback:
The blue car has priority, you are in front of a white arrow.

You see this because the arrow belonging to the white car is red.

questions_en.question: You want to turn right. Do you need to give priority to the cyclist?
questions_en.feedback: The cyclist goes straight on the same road, and thus has priority.

questions_en.question: You are going straight. Do you need to give priority to the cyclist?
questions_en.feedback: You are driving on a priority road, you can tell from the sign and because the cyclist has a yield line in front of him. You have priority over the cyclist.

questions_en.question: You want to go straight. Do you need to yield to the cyclist?
questions_en.feedback: The moped is coming from the right, so she has priority.

questions_en.question: Is there always a blind spot?
questions_en.feedback: There is always a blind spot.

questions_en.question: You are driving on the left side of a truck. What is the best thing to do now?
questions_en.feedback: When driving next to a truck, for safety's sake make sure you leave his blind spot as soon as possible.
options: Make sure you leave his blind spot
Provide light signals so he knows you are driving alongside him

questions_en.question: You add 2 extra mirrors on top of the normal mirrors. Is there still a blind spot?
questions_en.feedback: There is always a blind spot.

questions_en.question: Je ziet iemand die wil oversteken met een blindengeleidehond. Jij hebt volgens de borden voorrang. Stop je?
questions_en.feedback: Iemand die over wil steken met een blindengeleidehond geef je voorrang.

questions_en.question: Who can use the whole area of an erf?
questions_en.feedback: An erf is meant for playing children and pedestrians

questions_en.question: Do you need to give priority to predestrians when they want to get out of a vehicle?
questions_en.feedback: You need to give priority to predestrians. The predestrians have no platform to wait safely. If they would have had a platform, you would not have needed to let them go first.

questions_en.question: You see a pedestrian who has trouble moving around. Do you let them go first?
questions_en.feedback: You always give priority to a pedestrian who has trouble walking.

questions_en.question: Who goes first?
questions_en.feedback: At the end of an erf, you can assume you are dealing with an entry-exit construction. In that case, you need to give priority to all traffic and thus this pedestrian.

questions_en.question: Is a mobility scooter using the footpath a pedestrian?
questions_en.feedback: A mobility scooter driving on a footpath is a pedestrian. A mobility scooter driving on a bike path follows the rules for a driver.

questions_en.question: A funeral procession with identifiers is approaching. A pedestrian wants to cross on the zebra crossing. Who goes first?
questions_en.feedback:
Military columns and funeral procession with identifiers do not need to stop for zebra crossings!

This applies to the behaviour of funeral procession and military column regarding pedestrians on or near a pedestrian crossing.
options: The pedestrian on the zebra crossing

questions_en.question: Someone is walking next to their bicycle and want to cross on a zebra crossing. Do you need to let them go first?
questions_en.feedback: Yes, you need to let them go first. Someone walking besides their bicycle is a pedestrian and a pedestrian has priority on a zebra crossing.

questions_en.question: Is the car allowed to overtake here?
questions_en.feedback: You are not allowed to overtake when approaching a zebra crossing.

questions_en.question: Is a handicapped vehicle a person with difficulty moving?
questions_en.feedback: A handicapped vehicle like a mobility scooter is not counted as a person with difficulty moving.

questions_en.question: A mobility scooter is driving on the road and approaching a zebra crossing. Does he need to give priority to pedestrians who want to cross here?
questions_en.feedback: A mobility scooter following the road needs to keep to the rules for drivers. That is why he needs to yield to pedestrians on the zebra.

questions_en.question: Do you need yield here?
questions_en.feedback: A mobility scooter needs to follow the rules for the part of the road he is on, so he is a pedestrian on the pavement. He therefore does not get priority. A mobility scooter is counted as a handicapped vehicle and not as someone with trouble walking.

questions_en.question: Who are these signs meant for?
questions_en.feedback: This sign is meant for people with auditory impairment, someone could, for example, place this sign on the back of their moped.

questions_en.question:
A pedestrian wants to cross at a zebra. The pedestrian light is red.
Does the pedestrian have priority?
questions_en.feedback: Traffic lights trump road signs. The pedestrian needs to wait until the pedestrian light turns green.

questions_en.question: Can you let someone get out at a pedestrian crossing?
questions_en.feedback: 5 metres before and after a pedestrian crossing, you cannot park, overtake or stop.

questions_en.question: Do these traffic signs also apply to pedestrians?
questions_en.feedback: These traffic signs apply to drivers.

questions_en.question: Who goes first?
questions_en.feedback: You are in front of a red arrow, so the blue car goes first.

questions_en.question: Who goes first?
questions_en.feedback: Blind people with a stick with 1 or more red rings who indicate that they want to cross, need to get priority.

questions_en.question: Who goes first?
questions_en.feedback: You need to yield to pedestrians that want to go straight on the same road.

questions_en.question: Who has priority?
questions_en.feedback: The car has priority, he is crossed by the pedestrian. The rule 'drivers get priority on paved roads', is not applicable to pedestrians.

questions_en.question: The pedestrian goes straight. Who has priority?
questions_en.feedback: The signs do apply to other drivers. The car needs to stop in front of the stop sign, then look if no drivers are approaching on the intersection, then he can continue driving.

questions_en.question: Do you need to yield to the pedestrians?
questions_en.feedback: When they exit the tram, the pedestrians can wait safely on the platform, which is why you do not need to yield to them.
options: No, they can safely wait on the platform.

questions_en.question: You see the police with only their flashing lights on. Do you need to yield?
questions_en.feedback: No, you are not obligated to yield to the police if they only have light signals on. They are only 'emergency vehicles' when they have both light and audio signals on.
options: Yes, you must always give priority to the police.

questions_en.question: What colour has the flag on a following car in a military column?
questions_en.feedback: The following vehicles in a military column have a blue flag on the right side, on the front of the vehicle.

questions_en.question: Do you need to move to the emergency lane when an emergency vehicle (police) approaches?
questions_en.feedback: You do not move to the emergency lane. The emergency lane is meant for emergencies, so also for emergency vehicles that want to pass.

questions_en.question: The first vehicle in the funeral procession approaches you from the left. Who goes first?
questions_en.feedback: The first vehicles needs to follow the regular traffic rules. Seeing as you came from the right in this situation, you go first.

questions_en.question: The first car in the funeral procession wants to enter the roundabout. Do you need to let them go first?
questions_en.feedback: The first vehicle in the funeral procession needs to follow the normal rules, so they need to wait before the yield line.

questions_en.question: A pedestrian wants to cross on a zebra crossing. A military column approaches. Who needs to stop?
questions_en.feedback: The first vehicle in the column needs to follow normal traffic rules. Seeing as a pedestrian has priority at a zebra crossing, the military column needs to stop and give priority.

questions_en.question: You want to go straight, do you need to give priority to the military column?
questions_en.feedback: You are driving on a priority road, it is the start of the column so you do not need to yield to the military column.

questions_en.question: On what side is the blue light (blue translucent hood over the headlight) of the first vehicle in the military column?
questions_en.feedback: All vehicles in the military column have a coloured right headlight. The first vehicle and the following vehicles have a blue right headlight and the last vehicle has a green right headlight.

questions_en.question: A bus wants to drive away within the built-up area. Does the military column need to yield to the bus?
questions_en.feedback: The first vehicle in the column needs to follow normal traffic rules, which is why they need to yield to a bus that indicates it wants to drive away within the built-up area.

questions_en.question: The first car in the military column drives through a green light. While driving, the light turns red. The rest of the column runs the red light. Is that allowed?
questions_en.feedback: When a military column already started driving, they are allowed to run red lights. Obviously, you cannot if you're driving between them.

questions_en.question: Can you stand still here to load/unload?
questions_en.feedback: You are allowed to stand still for loading/unloading on a tram track that is part of the same road where drivers can drive. You cannot stand still on a separate lane for trams!

questions_en.question: This tram is driving 40 km/h. Is it wise to overtake them on the right?
questions_en.feedback: When a tram is going 40 km/h, it is not wise to overtake them on the right, even if you are allowed to overtake a tram on the right. The speed difference is too big. The space alongside the tram is small - the tram could stop and passengers need to be able to get on and off.

questions_en.question: Do you need to stop for customs or military police if they ask you to do so?
questions_en.feedback: Customs or Military Police always have the right to stop you.

questions_en.question: You see the police with only their flashing lights on. Do you need to yield?
questions_en.feedback:
You only need to yield to the police when they have the sirens and flashing lights on.
Only flashing lights often means something is going on, but that no direct priority is needed.

questions_en.question: Which vehicles can cross through a funeral procession?
questions_en.feedback: This is not allowed out of respect to the deceased and their bereaved.

questions_en.question: A bus wants to drive away in the built-up area. Does a funeral procession need to yield to the bus?
questions_en.feedback: A funeral procession has priority regarding a bus that wants to drive away from the bus stop in a built-up area.

questions_en.question: On what side is the green light (green translucent hood over the headlight) of the last vehicle in the military column?
questions_en.feedback: The last car in a military column has 1 green light on the right side.

questions_en.question: A police car is approaching an intersection without designated priorities, with no siren or flashing lights. Who goes first?
questions_en.feedback: Because the police did not turn on their siren or lights, they count as a normal vehicle in traffic. Regular priority rules apply, and as he came from the right, he still goes first.

questions_en.question: Who goes first?
questions_en.feedback: The funeral procession comes from the right on an intersection without designated priorities, and therefore has priority.

questions_en.question: What colour do(es) the flag(s) have on the first vehicle of a military column?
What image shows one of the following cars in a military column?
questions_en.feedback: A following vehicle in a military column has a flag on the left side. The first vehicle has two blue flags and the last vehicle has a green flag on the left side.

questions_en.question: Which is the last car in a military column?
What do emergency vehicles have?
questions_en.feedback: Emergency vehicles always have flashing lights and sirens.

questions_en.question: The first car in a funeral procession runs a red light. Is this correct?
questions_en.feedback: A funeral procession only has priority on an intersection without any designated priorities. The provision does not apply to priority intersections, roundabouts and intersections with traffic lights, because it is too dangerous for the funeral procession to run red lights and ignore priority signs in today's heavy traffic.

questions_en.question: A pedestrian wants to cross on a zebra crossing. A tram is approaching. Who needs to stop?
questions_en.feedback: A tram needs to yield to pedestrians who are crossing, or visibly want to cross on a zebra crossing.

questions_en.question: Do you need to yield to the tram?
questions_en.feedback: The tram has a yield line, and therefore no priority.

questions_en.question: Who goes first?
questions_en.feedback: You are on a priority road, that is why you go first.

questions_en.question: You want to go straight, do you need to yield to the tram?
questions_en.feedback: The tram has priority over the car.

questions_en.question: Can you pre-sort to the left?
questions_en.feedback: Yes, a car may pre-sort in front of a tram.

questions_en.question: Can you stand still here to load/unload?
questions_en.feedback:
You are allowed to stand still for loading/unloading on a tram track that is part of the same road where drivers can drive. The yellow stripe on the pavement is interrupted, so you may stop here.

You cannot stand still on a separate lane for trams!

questions_en.question: You want to drive away. Do you need to yield to the pedestrians.
questions_en.feedback: Driving away counts as a special manoeuvre, and when you are executing one of these manoeuvres, you are obligated to let all other traffic go first.

questions_en.question: Who do you need to give priority when you see this sign?
questions_en.feedback: In this case you are dealing with an entry/exit construction and you need to yield to all other road users.

questions_en.question: You accidentally entered the wrong autoweg entry. Can you reverse to go back?
questions_en.feedback: You are not allowed to drive in reverse on the autoweg.

questions_en.question: For which of the following do you not need to indicate direction?
questions_en.feedback: You still need to indicate direction when reversing if the situation requires it. When getting in and out, you need to turn on the alarm lights.

questions_en.question: Are you allowed to turn the car around on a one-way street?
questions_en.feedback: You are not allowed to do so, as soon as you turned around you are driving in the wrong direction, which is illegal.

questions_en.question: You want to turn left. Do you need to yield to the cyclist that wants to turn right?
questions_en.feedback: You are on an exit, so you need to let all other traffic go first.

questions_en.question: You want to leave the motorway. What do you always need to take into account?
questions_en.feedback: You decelerate as much as possible on the exit lane, not on the roadway. Note! Not every exit lane is the same, so you do not always have the same amount of time to decelerate.
options: You need to decelerate as much as possible on the exit lane
You need to decelerate as much as possible on the roadway
Every exit lane has the same length

questions_en.question: You are driving into an entry. Is this a special manoeuvre?
questions_en.feedback: Driving onto an entry is a special manoeuvre, you need to let all other traffic go first.

questions_en.question: You want to exit. What do you do?
questions_en.feedback: When leaving a road, you only start braking when you're driving on the exit lane.
options: You brake on the exit, so that other traffic is not hindered.
You start braking on the roadway, so you don't go too fast
You start driving faster, so that the truck behind me can also go faster

questions_en.question: You see this sign. What is the best thing to do if you're on the 2nd lane?
questions_en.feedback: The lane where drivers drive onto from the left will end, and ends in your lane, so make place by moving to the left lane.
options: Change to the left lane to make way for the other traffic
Change to the outermost right lane

questions_en.question: Who do you need to yield to if you want to turn your vehicle around?
questions_en.feedback: Turning the car is a special manoeuvre. You cannot hinder anyone in traffic when doing this, not even pedestrians.

questions_en.question: Who has priority?
questions_en.feedback: The cyclist comes from the right, and you are exiting an erf, so you need to yield to all traffic.

questions_en.question: You want to drive away. Do you need to indicate your direction?
questions_en.feedback: You always need to indicate your direction to let other road users know what you're planning.

questions_en.question: You want to turn around here. Is that allowed?
questions_en.feedback: If you turn around on a one-way street, you will be driving against traffic. This is not allowed.

questions_en.question: You want to turn around here, is that allowed?
questions_en.feedback: By turning here you will cross the continuous line, this is not allowed and you cannot turn around here.

questions_en.question: You want to turn around on an intersection, is that allowed?
You are driving on an autoweg and are in a hurry. You want to turn around. Is that allowed?
questions_en.feedback: It is illegal to turn around on an autoweg.

questions_en.question: You want to turn around here, is that allowed?
questions_en.feedback: You are not allowed to turn around on the motorway. This is extremely dangerous!

questions_en.question: What bus do you need to yield to if they indicate they want to drive away from a bus stop?
questions_en.feedback: Within the built-up area only public buses have priority when driving away from a bus stop.

questions_en.question: Do you yield to the bus?
questions_en.feedback: When a bus indicates they want to drive away from the bus stop within the built-up area, you need to yield to them.

questions_en.question: Do you yield to the bus?
questions_en.feedback: When a bus indicates they want to drive away from the bus stop outside the built-up area, you do not need to yield to them.

questions_en.question: Can you let someone get out here?
questions_en.feedback: At a bus stop, at the block marking, you may only let someone quickly get in or out if you do not hinder a bus: you are not allowed to load/unload or park here.

questions_en.question: Can you let someone get out here?
questions_en.feedback: At a bus stop with no block marking, you may only let someone quickly get in or out if you do not hinder a bus.

questions_en.question: Are you allowed to stand still here?
questions_en.feedback: If there is no block marking, you cannot stop 12 metres before and after the bus stop sign.

questions_en.question: Are you allowed to unload here?
questions_en.feedback: You are not allowed to load/unload at a bus stop. You can only let a passenger get in or out.

questions_en.question: You want to go straight. Do you need to give the other car priority?
questions_en.feedback: The other car needs to wait because it is on an exit construction. You are go straight on the roadway.

questions_en.question: You see this sign. What is the best thing to do if you're on the 2nd lane?
questions_en.feedback: If you remain in the same lane you will collide with traffic on the through lane. You are better off taking the right lane, which makes it safer for other traffic to enter.
options: Change to the outermost right lane
Change to the left lane to make way for the other traffic

questions_en.question: You want to turn right. Are you correctly pre-sorted?
questions_en.feedback: In this case, you are not allowed to pre-sort on the bike path, because it is bordered by a continuous line. You are currently in the right spot.

questions_en.question: Which way are your wheels turned if you are standing still and want to turn right?
questions_en.feedback: The wheels of a vehicle are generally always straight when standing still. That way the chance is smallest that you would go off the road if another vehicle hit the back of yours.

questions_en.question: You want to turn right. Can you stay in this lane?
questions_en.feedback: You cannot keep driving left if it isn't necessary, which is why you need to move to the right lane.

questions_en.question: What does the orange arrow mean?
questions_en.feedback: A matrix sign with a diagonal 'banning' arrow means that you can no longer use that lane further down. You are supposed to already change to the lane the arrow is pointing to.

questions_en.question: You and the bus both want to turn left. Is this the correct way of pre-sorting?
questions_en.feedback: A bus needs lots of space to take the turn. The bus cannot pass this way. You should have stopped earlier and move a bit further to the right, so that the bus would have had enough space.

questions_en.question: How many metres to the railway crossing?
questions_en.feedback: Every red stripe on these poles stands for a distance of 80 metres to the railway crossing. This pole has two stripes, s the distance is two times 80 = 160 metres.

questions_en.question: There is no bridle path. Where must the rider ride?
questions_en.feedback: If the verge is suitable, the rider rides in the verge. He can also ride on the road, a rider is a driver after all.
options: On the roadway or in the grassy verge

questions_en.question: You want to turn left here. Can you do that in this way>?
questions_en.feedback: This is a separated lane. If you want to turn left you must take the lane that the blue sign with the arrow points to. If you drive in like this, you will drive against traffic.

questions_en.question: Can you stand still on a non-compulsory bicycle lane?
questions_en.feedback: A non-compulsory bicycle lane is a part of the roadway also intended for motor vehicles. You may stand still, park and drive here.

questions_en.question: Are you correctly pre-sorted?
questions_en.feedback: When there is no centre line on the road, you can place your wheel against the road axis.

questions_en.question: What are you not allowed to do on a one-way street?
questions_en.feedback: If you turn around on a one-way street, you will be driving against traffic. This is extremely dangerous!
options: Stand still on the left side of the road

questions_en.question: Can you keep driving on the outermost left lane on a roundabout?
questions_en.feedback: You need to keep right on a roundabout.

questions_en.question: When can you use the gore point?
questions_en.feedback: It is always forbidden to drive across the gore point.
options: When pre-sorting for turning left or right

questions_en.question: Can cyclists ride two abreast?
questions_en.feedback: This is allowed, but not more than two cyclists.

questions_en.question: Can snorfiets riders ride two abreast?
questions_en.feedback: Snorfiets riders can never ride side by side, unless when overtaking one another. Also not next to a cyclist.

questions_en.question: Can mopeds ride two abreast?
questions_en.feedback: Mopeds can never ride side by side, unless when overtaking one another. Also not next to a cyclist.

questions_en.question: Can motorcycles ride two abreast?
questions_en.feedback: Motorcycles may not ride two abreast.

questions_en.question: Are you allowed to drive here?
questions_en.feedback: You are, but keep in mind that cyclist or mopeds can come towards you from the other side.

questions_en.question: Is this the correct place on the road?
questions_en.feedback: You need to stay in the right lane on the motorway, unless you are overtaking.

questions_en.question: Can pedestrians use the bike/moped path if no footpath is present?
questions_en.feedback: This is only allowed when no footpath is present. If there is no bike path, you are allowed to walk on the road.

questions_en.question: You want to turn right. Are you correctly pre-sorted?
questions_en.feedback: Seeing as the cyclist is going straight, you sort behind the cyclist.

questions_en.question: Is it okay to sort like this if you want to turn left?
questions_en.feedback: You are allowed to be in front of a tram for pre-sorting.

questions_en.question: You want to turn left here. Are you correctly pre-sorted?
questions_en.feedback: To pre-sort at an intersection with no road markings, you need to be as close to the imaginary centre axis as possible.

questions_en.question: You want to turn left here. Are you correctly pre-sorted?
questions_en.feedback: This is correct, this way cyclists and other traffic can still pass on the right.

questions_en.question: You want to go straight. Is this the correct lane?
questions_en.feedback: You can tell from the arrows on the road.

questions_en.question: Can you change to the left lane?
questions_en.feedback: The continuous line shows that you are not allowed to.

questions_en.question: Can you change to the left lane?
questions_en.feedback: There is sufficient space after the block marking, so this is allowed.

questions_en.question: You want to turn left here, is that allowed?
questions_en.feedback: It is too late, there is no more block marking to be seen. You are no longer allowed to turn left!

questions_en.question: Where does a brommobiel drive in a normal situation?
questions_en.feedback: If a road is present, the brommobiel needs to use this road.

questions_en.question: Can you park on a non-compulsory bicycle lane?
questions_en.feedback: This is allowed, unless it is a bike path and not a non-compulsory bicycle lane, since there would be a stop/park prohibition in that case.

questions_en.question: Can you pre-sort on a non-compulsory bicycle lane?
questions_en.feedback: If there is a cycling strip with interrupted stripping on the right of the roadway, then you may sort there, under the condition that it doesn't hinder cyclists and moped drivers.

questions_en.question: Which sign indicates a one-way street?
questions_en.feedback: Signs A and C are mandatory driving directions Sign B is a forbidden road, which means it regards a one-way street.

questions_en.question: You overtake a snorfiets rider here. Is that allowed?
questions_en.feedback: You can overtake a snorfiets at this sign. Not the 'faster' motor vehicles.

questions_en.question: You are overtaking here, is that allowed?
questions_en.feedback: You are allowed to overtake before or on a controlled railway crossing, but it is not advisable.

questions_en.question: You overtake a tractor here. IS that allowed?
questions_en.feedback: Only when a bottom sign has been attached indicating you can overtake tractors, is it allowed to overtake tractors.

questions_en.question: Why is overtaking dangerous?
questions_en.feedback: The speed of oncoming traffic is hard to estimate. They can suddenly be where you are, while you are still overtaking. Note: if you are driving a vehicle, you should logically be able to estimate the distance of other traffic.
options: It is hard to estimate how fast oncoming traffic is going
It is hard to estimate how far oncoming traffic is away from you

questions_en.question: You overtake like this. Are you maintaining enough distance?
questions_en.feedback: While overtaking you maintain a minimum of 1 metre distance on the side. The moped has almost no space to drive.

questions_en.question: You want to overtake a pre-sorted vehicle on the right, is that allowed?
questions_en.feedback: When a driver wants to turn to the left, you can overtake on the right.
