questions_en.question: Your car and trailer are 7,20 metres combined. Are you allowed to overtake using the left lane?
questions_en.feedback: You can only use the outermost left lane for pre-sorting. This road might lead, for example, to another city. When there are multiple lanes again, you naturally move back to the right lane.

questions_en.question: You are driving on the right of the block marking. Can you overtake on the right?
questions_en.feedback: When you are driving on the right of the block marking, you are allowed to overtake drivers on the roadway on the right.

questions_en.question: What can you not do at a pedestrian crossing?
questions_en.feedback: You cannot overtake anyone on, before or after a pedestrian crossing, including cyclists or motorcycles.

questions_en.question: What vehicle spacing do you maintain when overtaking?
questions_en.feedback: Always keep a distance of 2 seconds.

questions_en.question: Can you overtake on the right in a traffic jam?
questions_en.feedback: In a traffic jam you are not in control of the speed. That can cause the right lane to move faster than the left lane sometimes, which means overtaking on the right. This is allowed.

questions_en.question: When is an intermittent strip a warning stripe?
questions_en.feedback: When the stripes are longer than the breaks, this indicates a warning; a dangerous situation approaches, for example a dangerous road for overtaking.
options: If the lines are longer than the breaks
If the lines are shorter than the breaks

questions_en.question: From which vehicle can you recognize it is a small truck?
questions_en.feedback: The markings for A indicate that it regards a truck without a trailer. B is larger since it has a trailer on the back.

questions_en.question: What vehicle carries this marking on the back?
What do you know about this vehicle when you want to overtake it?
questions_en.feedback: You can tell from the markings on the back of the truck.
options: This vehicle is very long, that is why I need to properly estimate the distance I need to overtake it
This vehicle accelerates much slower than my vehicle, which makes overtaking easier

questions_en.question: You are in a traffic jam. What do motorcycles expect of you?
questions_en.feedback: By moving right, you make space for the motorcycle.
options: That you move to the right
That you move to the left

questions_en.question: You are overtaking here, is that allowed?
questions_en.feedback: You can overtake any vehicle with a discontinuous line.

questions_en.question: You want to move to the right lane, is that allowed?
questions_en.feedback: That is not allowed, you can tell because of the continuous line. This is often the case on an entry lane.

questions_en.question: You are overtaking, can you still move back to the right lane?
questions_en.feedback: You can if you are overtaking.

questions_en.question: The motorcycle is overtaking here. Is that safe?
questions_en.feedback: It is an unclear intersection with a lot of traffic. It is not safe.

questions_en.question: Can you overtake a brommobiel at this sign?
questions_en.feedback: You are not allowed to overtake a brommobiel either with sign F1.

questions_en.question: Can a motorcycle drive here?
questions_en.feedback: This sign means it is forbidden to drive here on a vehicle with more than two wheels. Seeing as a motorcycle has two wheels, it is allowed to drive here.

questions_en.question: Can you overtake here?
questions_en.feedback: You are not allowed to overtake in a turn, you can tell from the continuous stripe as well. Not even if they're cyclists.

questions_en.question: Can you overtake here?
questions_en.feedback: You can, there is a discontinuous line on your side.

questions_en.question: You want to switch to the left lane. Is that allowed?
questions_en.feedback: Even if stripes are faded or worn, they are still valid. You cannot change lanes here.

questions_en.question: You overtake a tractor here. Is that allowed?
questions_en.feedback: No, after this sign it is forbidden to overtake cars, motorcycles and agricultural vehicles.

questions_en.question: You overtake like this. Are you maintaining enough distance?
questions_en.feedback: There is about a metre between you and the car, so it is allowed.

questions_en.question: What do you need to keep in mind if you want to overtake this vehicle?
questions_en.feedback: You can tell from the white-red striped sign on the back of the tractor.
options: This is an agricultural vehicle with protruding parts
Oncoming traffic is hard to see

questions_en.question: You want to overtake the motorcycle. Is that allowed?
questions_en.feedback: You cannot overtake in a turn. You can tell from the continuous line.

questions_en.question: You want to overtake a rider. What do you do?
questions_en.feedback: It is dangerous to use the horn when overtaking a rider. The horse can get scared and deflect, causing accidents.
options: You deflect and adjust your speed
You use the horn and deflect
You use the horn and adjust your speed

questions_en.question: Is this the right way of overtaking?
questions_en.feedback: When overtaking, there needs to be at least 1 metre between you and the car you're overtaking.

questions_en.question: Can you overtake here?
questions_en.feedback: The continuous line is on your side, which means you cannot overtake.

questions_en.question: Can you overtake a tram on the right?
questions_en.feedback:
You are allowed to overtake a tram that's driving on the middle of the roadway on the right.

Do pay attention to cyclists and mopeds.

questions_en.question: What information can you find on a hectometre post?
questions_en.feedback: You can find the route number, stretch of road, kilometre indication and the maximum speed on a hectometre post. The maximum speed is sometimes omitted.
options: Route number, stretch of road, kilometre indication, maximum speed.
Route number, kilometre indication, maximum speed.

questions_en.question: Do you need to drive at walking pace here?
questions_en.feedback: Within an erf you end to drive at a walking pace (15 km/h) because this is a special environment for pedestrians and playing children. They must be able to walk here safely.

questions_en.question: How fast can a delivery fan with a trailer drive on the motorway (total weight 3000kg)?
questions_en.feedback: The maximum speed of a car with a trailer on the motorway is 90 km/h.

questions_en.question: Which sign indicates the built-up area?
questions_en.feedback: Sign B: 'Amsterdam' indicates you are driving into the built-up area. Sign A indicates a maximum speed.

questions_en.question: What is the maximum speed of a snorfiets?
questions_en.feedback: A snorfiets must be legally capped at 30 km/h

questions_en.question: How fast can a handicapped vehicle (with engine) drive on a bike/moped path within the built-up area?
questions_en.feedback: A handicapped vehicle with engine can drive 30 km/h on a bike/moped path within the built-up area.

questions_en.question: Do you need to wear a seatbelt in a T100 bus?
questions_en.feedback: It is mandatory for a T100 bus to have seatbelts available at every seat. If they are present, you are obligated to wear them.

questions_en.question: How fast can you drive after this sign?
questions_en.feedback: This sign indicates that the 70 km/h speed restriction has been lifted. You can drive the normally allowed speed for this road again.

questions_en.question: How fast is a brommobiel allowed to go?
questions_en.feedback: A brommobiel can go 45 km/h.

questions_en.question: You are the blue car. How fast are you allowed to drive here?
questions_en.feedback: You are driving on the motorway with a car an trailer, which is why your maximum speed is 90 km/h

questions_en.question: This sign is placed after the intersection. Where are you now?
questions_en.feedback: If the sign 'priority road' is placed after an intersection, you are outside the built-up area.

questions_en.question: What is the maximum allowed speed at 20:00h?
questions_en.feedback: After 19:00 you are allowed to drive 130 km/h. The bottom sign means that the maximum allowed speed 120 km/h only applies between the indicated times. You can go 130 km/h before or after.

questions_en.question: How fast can you go here?
questions_en.feedback: This is an autoweg, you recognize it from the road markings. You can go 100 km/h here.

questions_en.question: The maximum speed on this road is currently...?
questions_en.feedback: When a different speed is indicated on a matrix sign, you must always follow the indicated speed.

questions_en.question: What does this sign mean?
questions_en.feedback: This sign means end maximum speed.

questions_en.question: The maximum speed on this road is ...?
questions_en.feedback: This sign means you are in a built-up area. You can go 50km/h here.

questions_en.question: The maximum speed on this road is ...?
questions_en.feedback: This sign means you are leaving a built-up area. You can go 80km/h here.

questions_en.question: The maximum speed on this road is ...?
questions_en.feedback: Although this is a priority road, you are driving in the built-up area. You can go 50km/h here.

questions_en.question: What is the maximum speed outside the built-up area?
questions_en.feedback: The maximum speed outside the built-up area is 80 km/h.

questions_en.question: What is your maximum speed on this road?
questions_en.feedback: The maximum speed on the motorway, with a trailer, is 90 km/h

questions_en.question: What is the maximum speed on this road?
questions_en.feedback: You can drive no more than 80 km/h on a priority road outside the built-up area.

questions_en.question: Are you driving in a 30 km zone here?
questions_en.feedback: This sign means that the advisory speed is 30 km/h. You can go faster than 30 km/h, but it is not advisable.

questions_en.question: What is your maximum speed on this road?
questions_en.feedback: You can tell from the two lines in the middle of the road. The sidewalk has no influence on this.

questions_en.question: What is your maximum speed on this road?
questions_en.feedback: You can go 100 km/h on an autoweg.

questions_en.question: What kind of road is this?
questions_en.feedback: This is an autoweg, you recognize it from the autoweg sign. The speed limit is independent of the kind of road it is.
options: A road outside the built-up area

questions_en.question: What is your maximum speed on this road?
questions_en.feedback: Because of the green line in the middle of the road, you are allowed to go 100 km/h here.

questions_en.question: Can you go 120 km/h here?
questions_en.feedback: This is a motorway, you can go 120 km/h here.

questions_en.question: Can you go 60 km/h here?
questions_en.feedback: You can go 70 km/h here. You need to go at least 50 km/h on an autoweg, so you can drive 60 km/h here.

questions_en.question: You are driving 80 km/h. What is the wisest thing to do?
questions_en.feedback: You are driving too close to the truck. This is why you need to increase the distance between you and the truck.
options: Increase the distance between you and the truck
Decrease the distance between you and the truck

questions_en.question: If you drive here, can you drive 30 km/h hour?
questions_en.feedback: You are entering an erf. You can go 15km/h on an erf.

questions_en.question: What speed must you at least be able to go to use the autoweg?
questions_en.feedback: The minimum speed on an autoweg is 50 km/h.

questions_en.question: Are you driving in an erf?
questions_en.feedback: You are entering a living erf-zone here.

questions_en.question: What does his sign indicate?
questions_en.feedback: The round sign with the red edge over the hectometre post indicates that this is the maximum speed for that road.

questions_en.question: Are you driving in an erf?
questions_en.feedback: You are entering the built-up area.

questions_en.question: What speed do you need to go now?
questions_en.feedback: Always maintain the safest speed. You can go 50km/h here.

questions_en.question: You see this sign outside the built-up area. What does this mean for the amount of dangerous situations you might expect?
questions_en.feedback: At a sign that indicates you need to maintain a lower speed than the normal maximum speed for that area, you can expect that dangerous situations will arise.

questions_en.question: How fast can you go here?
questions_en.feedback: This sign means end maximum speed limit. You are to maintain the previous maximum speed again.

questions_en.question: Which sign indicates a maximum speed?
questions_en.feedback: The matrix sign indicates the maximum speed. The other sign is an advisory speed.

questions_en.question: What does this sign mean?
Which sign indicates a maximum speed?
questions_en.feedback: Sign B indicates end maximum speed and C is an advisory speed.

questions_en.question: How fast can you drive after this sign?
questions_en.feedback: The maximum speed is 80 km/h outside the built-up area.

questions_en.question: This sign indicates the beginning of a zone. Where does this zone end?
questions_en.feedback: This zone only ends at the sign 'End Zone'.
options: At the end of the street

questions_en.question: How fast can you go here?
questions_en.feedback: The maximum speed is 130 km/h on the motorway.

questions_en.question: What is the maximum speed on this road?
questions_en.feedback: You see that you can go 80 km/h because of road markings on the autoweg.

questions_en.question: You are driving 70km/h. Is that allowed?
questions_en.feedback: The advisory speed in this turn is 70 km/h.

questions_en.question: How fast can you go here?
questions_en.feedback: You can go 15 km/h on an erf.

questions_en.question: What speed can you drive here?
How fast can you drive on these roads?
questions_en.feedback: These are autowegen, you can go a maximum of 100 km/h on the autoweg.

questions_en.question: How fast can you drive on these roads?
questions_en.feedback: Foliage or plants in the middle of the two continuous lines on the autoweg should not be confused the green continuous line. You can still only go 80 km/h here.

questions_en.question: What is your maximum speed on this road?
questions_en.feedback: You can only go 80 km/h on an autoweg with 2 continuous lines.

questions_en.question: What is the maximum speed for a car with a trailer on the autoweg?
questions_en.feedback: The maximum speed of a car with a trailer on the autoweg is 90 km/h.

questions_en.question: What happens to the centrifugal force when your speed doubles?
questions_en.feedback: Your centrifugal force triples when you double your speed.

questions_en.question: How fast can you go on an erf?
questions_en.feedback: You can go 15 km/h on an erf. This also known as 'walking pace'.

questions_en.question: The sign indicating you are on a priority road is placed before an intersection. Where are you now?
questions_en.feedback: If the priority sign is placed in front of an intersection, you are within the built-up area.

questions_en.question: What is the maximum speed of a moped?
questions_en.feedback: A moped is capped at 45 km/h.

questions_en.question: How fast can a handicapped vehicle (electric) drive on a bike/moped path outside the built-up area?
questions_en.feedback: The handicapped vehicle can go up to 40 km/h on a bike/moped path outside the built-up area.

questions_en.question: How fast can a handicapped vehicle (with engine) go on a footpath?
questions_en.feedback: A handicapped vehicle, with or without engine, can go up to 6 km/h on a footpath.

questions_en.question: Can you stand still here for a while?
questions_en.feedback: You cannot let your vehicle stand still on or next to a bike path marked with a (dis)continuous line.

questions_en.question: You are in a traffic jam and see an emergency telephone alongside the road. Can you stop here and call to inform someone you will be late because of traffic?
questions_en.feedback: An emergency telephone is only intended for emergency situations, and you can only stop on the side of the highway in case of emergency.

questions_en.question: What does a blue line next to the parking spaces mean?
questions_en.feedback: If there is a blue line along the parking space you need to place a parking disk. If you park within a parking disk zone, you also need to place a disk behind your window.
options: Parking only with a parking disk behind your window
Only if you need to load/unload

questions_en.question: Can you let someone get in or out at a bus stop?
questions_en.feedback: You can let someone get in or out at a bus stop, but you cannot stand still to load/unload and you cannot hinder the bus.

questions_en.question: When can you drive and/or stand still on a cycling strip with a discontinuous line?
questions_en.feedback: If you want to turn, you can pre-sort on a cycling strip with a discontinuous line.
options: When you want to let someone get in or out.

questions_en.question: Can you park on the grassy verge here?
questions_en.feedback: You cannot park in the grassy verge if you are on a priority road outside the built-up area.

questions_en.question: Are you allowed to park on the roadway/roadside of a priority road within a built-up area?
questions_en.feedback: : If there is not explicitly a sign, or if you do not cause danger or hinder, you are simply allowed to park there.

questions_en.question: where can you not stand still at a pedestrian crossing?
questions_en.feedback: You cannot stand still before or after with your vehicle. Note! Standing still is something else than braking to yield.
options: 5 metres before and after a pedestrian crossing

questions_en.question: Do you always need to park in the parking spaces within an erf?
questions_en.feedback: Within an erf you always need to park within the spots, because otherwise you could cause sever hindrance.

questions_en.question: You want to let someone get out and do this on a cycling strip with discontinuous line. Is this allowed?
questions_en.feedback: No, you cannot stand still on or next to stretches of road intended for other users (such as cyclists).

questions_en.question: Can you let someone get out at this sign?
questions_en.feedback: This parking space can only be used by handicapped people for parking. But other road users are allowed to let someone get in or out.

questions_en.question: Can you park here?
questions_en.feedback: The yellow discontinuous line only applies to the side it is placed on, so you can park on the other side.

questions_en.question: At what sign can you stop?
questions_en.feedback: You can stop at sign A, but not park. You cannot stop or park at sign B.

questions_en.question: Can you park here to read the map?
questions_en.feedback: Because of the P sign, you are allowed to park in this refuge to read the map.

questions_en.question: Can you stop here to call someone?
questions_en.feedback: You can only stop on the emergency lane in emergency situations, it is not for calling!

questions_en.question: Can you stop here if you have engine trouble?
questions_en.feedback: Parking or stopping on or next to the bus lane is illegal, even when you're having engine trouble.

questions_en.question: Are you allowed to load/unload here?
questions_en.feedback: Yes, you can stand still in an erf for loading/unloading. Or to let someone get out of the car.

questions_en.question: Can you park here?
questions_en.feedback: It is forbidden to park in the verge of an autoweg.

questions_en.question: Can you park here?
questions_en.feedback: Parking in the verge is allowed within the built-up area. The sign only applies once you've passed it.

questions_en.question: Can you park here?
questions_en.feedback: Parking in the verge outside of the built-up area is allowed, unless there is a sign that indicates you cannot.

questions_en.question: Can you let someone get out here?
questions_en.feedback: The yellow discontinuous line means that you cannot park here, or load/unload, but that you are allowed to let someone quickly get in or out.

questions_en.question: Can you stop here?
questions_en.feedback: The continuous yellow line applies to the other side of the road, this is allowed. Stopping, against traffic, on the other side of the road is also allowed.

questions_en.question: Can you park here?
questions_en.feedback: If a continuous yellow line has been applied to the other side of the road, you cannot stand still or park on that side of the road.

questions_en.question: Can you stop here to make a call?
questions_en.feedback: If a continuous yellow line has been applied to the other side of the road, you cannot stand still or park on that side of the road.

questions_en.question: Can you park in a tunnel?
questions_en.feedback: Standing still (and therefore parking) in a tunnel is illegal.

questions_en.question: Can you park here?
questions_en.feedback: No, you can only park in the designated parking spaces within an erf.

questions_en.question: You stop next to a cycling strip and want to let someone get out, is that allowed?
questions_en.feedback: Stopping next to the cycling strip is forbidden, unless there are parking spaces present.

questions_en.question: You stop on a cycling strip and want to let someone get out, is that allowed?
questions_en.feedback: You cannot stop or park on or next to a cycling strip. Not even to let someone get in or out.

questions_en.question: Can you stop here and deliver a package?
questions_en.feedback: This sign means there it is forbidden to park here. So you can stop here to load/unload.

questions_en.question: Can you park next to a discontinuous yellow line?
questions_en.feedback: You cannot park next to a discontinuous yellow line.

questions_en.question: Can you let someone get out here?
questions_en.feedback: Parking or stopping on or next to the bus lane is illegal, even when you just want to let someone get out.

questions_en.question: You stop here with the alarm lights on to deliver a package, is that allowed?
questions_en.feedback: This sign means it is forbidden to stop or park here. You cannot stop here with the alarm lights on either.

questions_en.question: You stop here to load/unload, is that allowed?
questions_en.feedback: This sign means it is forbidden to stop or park here. You cannot stop here with the alarm lights on either.

questions_en.question: To which side of the road does this sign apply?
questions_en.feedback: This sign means that you cannot park on either side of the road.

questions_en.question: Which sign means 'forbidden to stop'?
questions_en.feedback: You can stop at sign A, but not park. You cannot stop or park at sign B.

questions_en.question: Can you park here?
questions_en.feedback: Although the sign indicates you cannot park here, you can park in the parking spots.

questions_en.question: Are you allowed to park on the roadway of a priority road outside the built-up area?
questions_en.feedback: Parking on the roadway of a priority road outside the built-up area is forbidden. This prohibition is not applicable to the verge, only for the roadway.

questions_en.question: A cyclist wants to cycle across the zebra crossing, do you need to let them go first?
questions_en.feedback: A zebra crossing only provides priority to pedestrians. If a cyclist is on his bicycle, he is not a pedestrian.

questions_en.question: Can you let someone get out at this sign?
questions_en.feedback: You can let someone get in or out at this sign.

questions_en.question: Can you let someone get out at this sign?
questions_en.feedback: You can stand still in a handicapped parking space to let a passenger get in or out. It is also allowed to stand still here to load/unload.

questions_en.question: Can you park here?
questions_en.feedback: Unless you are the vehicle with that licence plate, you cannot park here.

questions_en.question: Where can you park on a priority road's roadway?
questions_en.feedback: As long as you do not hinder other traffic or create dangerous situations, you are allowed to park on a priority road within the built-up area.

questions_en.question: Can you let someone get out here?
questions_en.feedback: You cannot stand still or park 5 metres before or after a pedestrian crossing.

questions_en.question: Can you let someone get out here?
questions_en.feedback: The emergency refuge is solely intended for emergency situations, you can never just let someone get in or out.

questions_en.question: Can you let someone get out here?
questions_en.feedback: It is incredibly dangerous to let someone get out on the motorway, which is why it is strictly forbidden!

questions_en.question: Can you park here?
questions_en.feedback: The yellow discontinuous line only applies to the side it is placed on, so you can park on the other side.

questions_en.question: At what sign can you stop?
questions_en.feedback: You can stop at sign A, but not park. You cannot stop or park at sign B.

questions_en.question: Can you park here to read the map?
questions_en.feedback: Because there is a parking sign, you can stop here to read the map.

questions_en.question: Can you stop here to call someone?
questions_en.feedback: You can only stop on the emergency lane in emergency situations, it is not for calling!

questions_en.question: Can you stop here if you have engine trouble?
questions_en.feedback: It is always forbidden to park in the bus lane.

questions_en.question: Are you allowed to load/unload here?
questions_en.feedback: You can stand still in an erf to load/unload or to let someone get in/out.

questions_en.question: Can you park here?
questions_en.feedback: You cannot park on the verge of an autoweg.

questions_en.question: Can you park here?
questions_en.feedback: You are allowed to park in the verge within the built-up area. The 'no parking' sign is further down than the car is parked, you can still park here. But not after the sign.

questions_en.question: Can you park here like this?
questions_en.feedback: In the Netherlands you are allowed to park against traffic, so this is allowed. The yellow stripe is only applicable to the other side.

questions_en.question: Can you park here?
questions_en.feedback: Even if you are normally allowed to park in the grassy verge outside the built-up area, there is a sign here that prohibits it.

questions_en.question: What does this sign mean?
questions_en.feedback: This sign means 'parking only for permit holders', this is indicated on the sign.
options: Parking only if you need to load/unload

questions_en.question: Can you let someone get out here?
questions_en.feedback: You are allowed to let someone get in or out alongside a discontinuous yellow line. But you cannot park here.

questions_en.question: Can you stop here?
questions_en.feedback:
The continuous yellow line is on the other side of the road, it does not apply to the side where you're parked.

You can stop at this stripe, even if it were on your side.

questions_en.question: Can you park here?
questions_en.feedback: You cannot park or stop on top of or next to a continuous yellow line.

questions_en.question: Can you stop here to make a call?
questions_en.feedback: You cannot park or stop on top of or next to a continuous yellow line. Not even to make a phone call.

questions_en.question: Can you park in a tunnel?
questions_en.feedback: It is forbidden to stop and park in a tunnel.

questions_en.question: Can you park here?
questions_en.feedback: It is only allowed to park in the parking spaces on an erf.

questions_en.question: You stop next to a cycling strip and want to let someone get out, is that allowed?
questions_en.feedback: It is forbidden to stand still on a lane next to a cycling strip.

questions_en.question: You stop on a cycling strip and want to let someone get out, is that allowed?
questions_en.feedback: It is forbidden to stand still on a cycling strip.

questions_en.question: Can you stop here and deliver a package?
questions_en.feedback: This sign means 'no parking', but you can stop here.

questions_en.question: Can you park next to a discontinuous yellow line?
questions_en.feedback: You cannot park next to a discontinuous yellow line.

questions_en.question: Can you let someone get out here?
questions_en.feedback: It is forbidden to stop on a bus lane, even to let someone get out.

questions_en.question: You stop here with the alarm lights on to deliver a package, is that allowed?
questions_en.feedback: Alarm lights or not, it is forbidden to park and stop at this sign.

questions_en.question: You stop here to load/unload, is that allowed?
questions_en.feedback: It is forbidden to park and stop at this sign. Even for loading and unloading.

questions_en.question: To which side of the road does this sign apply?
questions_en.feedback: This sign applies to the side the sign is placed on.

questions_en.question: Can you park here?
questions_en.feedback: This sign applies to the side of the road the sign is placed on, except the stretches of road intended for that purpose. So, parking spots.

questions_en.question: Are you allowed to park on the roadway of a priority road outside the built-up area?
questions_en.feedback: Parking on the roadway of a priority road outside the built-up area is forbidden. It is allowed in the verge.

questions_en.question: A cyclist wants to cycle across the zebra crossing, do you need to let them go first?
questions_en.feedback: Pedestrians and drivers of handicapped vehicles have priority on a zebra crossing. Not cyclists.

questions_en.question: Can you let someone get out at this sign?
questions_en.feedback: You can, but you cannot park here.

questions_en.question: Can you let someone get out at this sign?
questions_en.feedback: You can, but you cannot park here.

questions_en.question: Can you park here?
questions_en.feedback: Unless you have a pass specifically for this purpose, you cannot park here.

questions_en.question: Can you let someone get out here?
questions_en.feedback: You cannot stand still (or park) on a pedestrian crossing, nor 5 metres before or after this crossing.

questions_en.question: Can you let someone get out here?
questions_en.feedback: The emergency refuge is only intended for emergencies. You cannot stop here, unless it's an emergency.

questions_en.question: Can you let someone get out here?
questions_en.feedback: You cannot stand still or park 5 metres before or after a zebra crossing. Not even to let someone get out.

questions_en.question: When do you use the horn?
questions_en.feedback: You only use the horn in case of immediate danger.
options: When you want to greet your friends in the street

questions_en.question:
joop jonker
You are the driver of the blue car. You want to take the turn. Do you need to indicate your direction?
questions_en.feedback: You indicate direction to the right to make it clear to the other traffic that you are really going to take the turn. That way the other traffic knows you are not planning to move back to the roadway.

questions_en.question: You are driving on the motorway and want to take an exit. How many metres before the exit should you indicate you will?
questions_en.feedback: If you want to exit the motorway, you should indicate that using the blinker about 300 metres before the exit.

questions_en.question: Which signals does an emergency vehicle need to get priority?
questions_en.feedback: A vehicle needs to have both flashing lights and a siren to be counted as an emergency vehicle.

questions_en.question: A hearse is driving without any flags. Do you need yield here?
questions_en.feedback: A hearse only has priority when driving with flags and alarm lights.

questions_en.question: Why does the black vehicle use its warning lights?
questions_en.feedback: To indicate that a traffic jam is approaching and brisk braking is required, you could use your warning lights.
options: The vehicle warns other vehicles behind him of the traffic jam.
Because the vehicle has engine problems.
Because the vehicle is driving in a convoy.

questions_en.question: You want to drive onto a road with a mandatory driving direction, do you need to indicate your direction?
questions_en.feedback: You must always indicate direction if you're turning, even if you cannot go the other way.
options: Yes, you must always indicate direction
No, you can only go in one direction

questions_en.question: Where are you allowed to, in case of immediate danger, flash your lights?
questions_en.feedback: If there is immediate danger, and you are able to warn other drivers by flashing your lights, you are always allowed to do so.

questions_en.question: Je rijdt op de autoweg en wilt afslaan. Hoeveel meter voor de afslag moet je richting aangeven?
questions_en.feedback: Op de autoweg 200 m. Op de autosnelweg 300 m. Dit heeft allemaal te maken met de plaatsing van de wegbewijzeringsborden. Op de autoweg 800, 400 en 200 meter. Op de autosnelweg 1200, 900, 600 en 300 m.

questions_en.question: you have engine problems. What is the minimum distance you need to place the warning triangle at?
questions_en.feedback: You always place a hazard triangle 30 metres away from your car.

questions_en.question: Who needs to give a signal if danger is imminent?
questions_en.feedback: All drivers are supposed to give a signal if danger is imminent.

questions_en.question: Can you greet your friends with a light signal?
questions_en.feedback: This is only allowed to indicate that there is a danger.

questions_en.question: What signal do you give other traffic if you are parked with car trouble?
questions_en.feedback: You only put down a hazard triangle once your alarm lights are on, they are mandatory.
options: You turn on the alarm lights
You turn the blinkers on to the left and right

questions_en.question: You are parked on the emergency lane with car troubles. Your alarm lights are on. Do you also have to place the hazard triangle, if you have one?
questions_en.feedback: It is not obligatory to have a hazard triangle in the Netherlands, but if you have one you are obligated to place it down.

questions_en.question: You are going to overtake. Do you need to indicate your direction?
questions_en.feedback: You also always have to indicate direction during takeover manoeuvres. However, here (before the zebra crossing) you are not allowed to overtake.

questions_en.question: Are you obligated to have your lights on when driving in a tunnel?
questions_en.feedback: You must have your low beam lights on when driving in a tunnel.

questions_en.question: It is raining hard. You turn on the low beam lights. Is this allowed?
questions_en.feedback: It even desirable. By using the low beam lights you will see better, and be better visible yourself.

questions_en.question: Do riders need to have head and tail lights?
questions_en.feedback: A lamp with a red light must be beaming backwards, and a white or yellow light must be beaming forwards.

questions_en.question: You are driving in the fog. You see 2 hectometre poles. You turn on your rear fog lamp, is that correct?
questions_en.feedback: If you still see two hectometre poles, your sight is at least 200 metres. That means you cannot have the rear fog lamp on yet, you can only do that when sight is less than 50 metres.

questions_en.question: Can you drive with high beam lights in the built-up area?
questions_en.feedback: As long as you follow the other rules regarding having the high beam lights on, you are allowed to do so inside and outside the built-up area.

questions_en.question: It's raining hard and your vision is less than 50 metres. What do you do in this situation?
questions_en.feedback: If it rains, you cannot use the rear fog lamp.
options: You do not drive faster than 50 km/h and do not drive to close to the car in front of you.
You turn on the rear fog lamp and do not drive faster than 50 km/h.

questions_en.question: An approaching vehicle is blinding you with their high beam lights, what do you do?
questions_en.feedback: If they blind you with their high beam lights, the best thing to do is to turn your head away from the light. This is the safest option.
options: You turn your head away from the light
You turn your high beam light on

questions_en.question: It's snowing and your vision is less than 200 metres. Can you turn on your front fog lamps?
questions_en.feedback: It doesn't matter what the cause is, if your vision is less than 200 metres you can have your front fog lamps on.

questions_en.question: Can you drive without licence plate lighting?
questions_en.feedback: The front and back of cars need to have a rectangular licence plate attached. The license plate on the back of the car needs to be illuminated if the car's lights are on.

questions_en.question: Can you use the front fog lamp(s) if it's raining very hard?
questions_en.feedback: You may use the front fog lights in case of serious visibility hinder because of the rain
options: Yes, but never your rear fog lamp during rain

questions_en.question: Je parkeert hier met stadslicht aan. Mag dat?
questions_en.feedback: Binnen de bebouwde kom mag je jouw stadslicht aanhebben. Buiten de bebouwde kom is het verplicht.

questions_en.question: Should the front lights and the rear lights be turned on at the same time with the license plate lights?
questions_en.feedback: It is mandatory that the license plate lights and the rear lights are simultaneously lit.

questions_en.question: Should towed trailers ordain lights?
questions_en.feedback: If the visibility is seriously hindered at day, and at night, towed trailers should have the rear lights and the registration plate illumination turned on

questions_en.question: You drive in the fog. The visibility is less than 50m. You turn on your rear fog lights, is that correct?
questions_en.feedback: In fog with visibility less than 50m you must turn on your fog lights.

questions_en.question: You are driving in the fog. The view is less than 100m. You turn on your rear fog light. Is this correct?
questions_en.feedback: You are only allowed to turn on your rear fog light if the view is less than 50m.

questions_en.question: It's snowing. Are you allowed to turn on the rear fog light?
questions_en.feedback: This is only allowed when the view is less than 50 meters.

questions_en.question: When can you turn on your rear fog lights?
questions_en.feedback: You can turn on your rear fog lights if it's foggy and the visibility is 50m or less.

questions_en.question: Can you use the front fog lights if it heavily raining?
questions_en.feedback: You may only use the front fog lights when it's raining.
options: Yes, but never the rear fog lights when it's raining.

questions_en.question: Can 'daytime running lights' be used in combination with other lights?
questions_en.feedback: This is not allowed, unless there is no other choice with new cars that are made this way.

questions_en.question: May you turn on your parking lights within urban areas?
questions_en.feedback: It is allowed, But it is not mandatory.

questions_en.question: Can you turn on your parking lights outside of urban areas?
questions_en.feedback: This is even mandatory whilst parking.

questions_en.question: What does this dash Sign symbol represent?
questions_en.feedback: This symbol represents High beam.

questions_en.question: You are driving with your high beams on, is that allowed?
questions_en.feedback: Outside of urban areas, you may use your high beams. Note the oncoming and outgoing traffic

questions_en.question: You are driving here with your dipped headlights on, is that allowed?
questions_en.feedback: Within urban areas, you can drive with your low beams on.

questions_en.question: May you drive with main beam on rural roads?
questions_en.feedback: This is allowed, as log as you are not restricting any traffic.

questions_en.question: When should dipped headlights and taillight be used?
questions_en.feedback: Even during the day when there is poor visibility, low beam should be used.
options: In poor visibility situations day and night
During the day whit poor visibility

questions_en.question: Which lights should one use with poor visibility during the day and at night?
questions_en.feedback: In poor visibility during the day and at night, you should always turn on your low beam.

questions_en.question: Is it allowed to use main beams during the day in poor visibility situation?
questions_en.feedback: During the day you are not allowed to drive using driving lights.

questions_en.question: Can you drive with side lights on?
questions_en.feedback: This is only allowed in combination with low-beam headlights or driving lights.

questions_en.question: Should the license plate of a coupled trailer be lit at night?
questions_en.feedback: The license plate of a coupled trailer is required to be visible, it must also be lit when the lamps of the trailer are on as well.

questions_en.question: You have the low sun in your back, what do you do to increase your visibility?
questions_en.feedback: To increase your visibility, turn on your low beam headlights.

questions_en.question: You see this prohibitory sign. Which drivers are not allowed in this way?
questions_en.feedback: The sign gives limited access for all drivers in both directions. This service plate shows that this only applies for lorry drivers. Moreover, it does not matter if a tractor does or does not have a trailer, it's still categorised as a lorry.
options: Only lorry drivers are not allowed here.
Only car drivers are not allowed in here.
Only articulated lorry drivers are not allowed in here

questions_en.question: You are driving and you see the traffic light has turned red. Should you lessen your speed or stop in this situation. How do you do it?
questions_en.feedback: You release the gas on time and leave the car to roll out You only switch gear when it is necessary. You also unmount only when it's necessary.
options: You release the gas and let the car roll out without using the gear.
You release the gas and get into a lower gear so you can accelerate quickly when the traffic light turns green.
You keep on driving so that you can be as far upfront as possible.

questions_en.question: You are driving 50 km/h and you have 50 to come to a halt. The traffic light turns "yellow". What to do now?
A Rijkswaterstaat car is driving in front of me and showing the Stop sign from its rear window. Should I stop now?
questions_en.feedback: Rijkswaterstaat is entitled to bring vehicles to a halt. If they show you a stop sign, you have to follow it.

questions_en.question: There is a crossing patrol on the road. Should I stop now?
questions_en.feedback: A crossing patrol on the road indicates that there are pedestrians who may cross, therefore you have to follow the stop sign that the crossing patrol is showing.

questions_en.question: Who gets a stop sign shown to?
questions_en.feedback: The traffic from behind the traffic policeman is retained by his raised arm. The traffic behind the traffic policeman should stop.
options: Traffic approached by a traffic policeman from behind.
Traffic approached by a traffic policeman from the front
Traffic approached by a traffic policeman from the left.

questions_en.question: a coach is driving on the bus lane. Is this allowed?
questions_en.feedback: A 'bus' lane is designated for buses. No coaches are allowed here.

questions_en.question: May I stop a bus lane?
questions_en.feedback: You are not allowed to be idle on or next to sections of roads designated for other sort of vehicles such as buses. A bus lane is intended for all buses, including regular service buses.

questions_en.question: The direction of the arrow on the traffic light points to the left. Can I go also straight?
questions_en.feedback: When you are already in lane at a traffic light junction, you should follow the direction of the lane you got into.

questions_en.question: Je nadert 1 geel knipperend licht. Wat doe je?
questions_en.feedback: Een geel knipperend licht betekent een waarschuwing voor een eventuele gevaarlijke situatie.
options: Je bent extra voorzichtig, want dit is een waarschuwing.
Je stopt, want je hebt nog tijd om te stoppen en het licht is geel.

questions_en.question: What does it mean when you see this?
questions_en.feedback: When you a traffic warden doing this, you should drive slower.

questions_en.question: While the military convoy was driving, they drove through a red light. I drive after the procession. May i drive at the rear now?
questions_en.feedback: When a military convoy has started driving through a green light and it turns red whilst they're crossing over, then they are allowed to drive through the red traffic light. You can't do that.
options: No, the red light still applies to me.
Yes, after all, they are all crossing over, and the other drivers know that they have to wait now.

questions_en.question: A yellow flashing light is mounted in the rear of this vehicle. What does this warn of?
questions_en.feedback: A yellow flashing light on a vehicle means: caution, this is exceptional transport.
options: The truckload of the lorry is 3 meters wide
This lorry does not drive faster than 50 km/h

questions_en.question: Who gets a stop sign shown to?
questions_en.feedback: The traffic approached by a traffic warden from the from, must stop instantly. You drive on the right side, so you are driving against his hand.
options: Traffic approached by a traffic warden from the front.
Traffic approached by a traffic warden from behind.
Traffic approached by a traffic warden from the left.

questions_en.question: Which road marking applies here?
questions_en.feedback: You should follow the temporary yellow marking signs when they are placed on the road.

questions_en.question: At which traffic light you should you pay extra attention to oncoming traffic?
questions_en.feedback: If there is no visible arrow on the traffic light, then it applies for all drivers approaching from the front. Here, you can expect oncoming traffic, traffic going to the left or to the right or straight ahead.

questions_en.question: Who do you stop for?
questions_en.feedback: you should top for all authorised such as identifiable officials when demanded.
options: All authorised such as identifiable officials

questions_en.question: Should you always stop for a red light?
questions_en.feedback: You should always stop for red light.

questions_en.question: The traffic light is green, but there are still cars crossing, should you follow the green light?
questions_en.feedback: The overall safety, stop and wait until the intersection is free and then you can continue on driving unhindered.

questions_en.question: The traffic light is red and there is a bicycle symbol. Should you stop now?
questions_en.feedback: When the bicycle symbol is projected in the traffic then the traffic light applies to cyclists, light-moped riders and motorcyclists who follow the mandatory bicycle/moped path.

questions_en.question: You drive on this road, what kind of traffic you would not encounter here?
questions_en.feedback: This is an example of a distributor road. This is indicated by a somewhat rural surroundings and double centre line markings on the roadway. The maximum speed is 80 km/h. These road users are not allowed here because the centre line marking was extended. When the centre line marking is interrupted, agricultural traffic and microcars are allowed to drive here.
options: Pedestrians, cyclists, mopeds, motorcycles, agricultural vehicles, microcars

questions_en.question: A continuous line is located on your side, on the other hand, is a broken line. Can you overtake now?
questions_en.feedback: If the solid line is on your side then you are not allowed to cross over and thus not allowed to overtake?

questions_en.question: There is a continuous line in my lane. The rush-hour lane is open. May I drive across the continuous line?
questions_en.feedback: Normally, the lane to the right of a continuous line is used as an emergency lane, thus it's only used in cases of an emergency. In cases where the rush-hour lane is open, this lane serves as a regular driving lane which means that you are allowed to cross over the continuous line.

questions_en.question: Yellow and white markings are to be found on the road. Where should i drive?
questions_en.feedback: You should follow the yellow markings when seen.

questions_en.question: Can you park on a masking area?
questions_en.feedback: It is prohibited to occupy a masking area with a vehicle.

questions_en.question: Should you always stop for shark teeth?
questions_en.feedback: As long as the shark teeth are not accompanied with a stop command and there is no priority traffic, you should not stop.

questions_en.question: When shouldn't you stop for shark teeth?
questions_en.feedback: The rule at shark teeth is: You should give priority to all drivers on the intersecting road. That does not apply to pedestrians crossing the road. Therefore, you have to stop for a cyclist coming on your left and not for a pedestrian crossing on the road.
options: If a pedestrian is located on the intersecting road.
If a cyclist is coming from the left.

questions_en.question: I'm on a sorting lane to the left, but I want to go to the right. May I change lanes?
questions_en.feedback: When you are in a pre-sorted state you can not change direction.

questions_en.question:
There is no 'STOP' sign present.
Do I have to stop for this line?
questions_en.feedback: Stop lines always are always accompanied by a stop sign. Therefore, you must stop before the stop line.

questions_en.question: You want to take the first exit to the left, is that allowed?
questions_en.feedback: This sorting arrow has a blocked split. This means that you are not allowed to take the first exit to the left. You may take the second exit to the left.

questions_en.question: May you get in lane on this arrow on the road?
questions_en.feedback: On this arrow on the road, you are allowed to get in lane. This sorting arrow has a blocked split. This means that you are not allowed to take the first exit to the left. You may take the second exit to the left.

questions_en.question: Can you drive on a wedge when the rush-hour lane is closed?
questions_en.feedback: You may not use a wedge.

questions_en.question: Can you drive on the nose when the rush-hour lane is closed?
questions_en.feedback: You can not drive on the nose.

questions_en.question: Can you ride on the nose when the rush-hour lane is open?
questions_en.feedback: In general, You are not allowed to use the nose, unless you are on a rush-hour lane where roads are merged.

questions_en.question: There is a traffic diversion. Should I follow the direction of the yellow arrow?
questions_en.feedback: You can follow the direction of the yellow arrow, if you want to follow the traffic diversion. It is not a mandatory direction.

questions_en.question: You are driving on the left lane of the road. Can you move to the right lane?
questions_en.feedback: There is a continuous line on your side, which you are not allowed to crossover.

questions_en.question: You are driving on the right lane of the road. Can you move to the left lane?
questions_en.feedback: There is a broken line on your side, so you can move to the left lane.

questions_en.question: You are walking with your moped. Can you get in here?
questions_en.feedback: People walking with their mopeds are categorised as pedestrians. Therefore, this limited access rule also applies to you.

questions_en.question: Which sign means "forbidden to stand still and forbidden to park '?

questions_en.question: You want to turn right here, is that allowed?

questions_en.question: On which side of the road is this sign valid?

questions_en.question: May microcars drive in here?

You have to be on time in the left lane

If the traffic light, however, is broken or idle then you have to follow the rules that are imposed by the indicated boards or signs on the road.

questions_en.question: At which sign should you turn to the left?

questions_en.question: At which board you have to turn right?

This is reflected in the colours of the arrows. If the arrow facing up is red then you have no priority

If the arrow facing up is white then you do have priority.

options: The helmet should be a little on the tight side.
The helmet should be a little spacious.

questions_en.question: You want to go straight ahead, should you let the cyclist go first?
questions_en.feedback: The cyclist is coming from the right, and therefore has priority.

questions_en.question: What is the speed limit on this road outside the urban area?
questions_en.feedback: A motorway has a speed limit of 100 km / h.

questions_en.question: Can you overtake here?
questions_en.feedback: The continuous line means that you can not overtake here.

questions_en.question: You want to overtake the car. Is that allowed?
questions_en.feedback: 5 meters before, 5 meters after a crosswalk and on the crosswalk itself, it is forbidden to overtake.

questions_en.question: Is the person on the back looking correctly the same way as you are doing?
questions_en.feedback: The passenger is looking to the left while the you are going to the right through a bend. If you take the right turn, then de driving mate should be looking to the right.

questions_en.question: Someone is walking with a horse on the road. What is this person?
questions_en.feedback: A person walking beside a horse must still drive it. Therefore, this person is a driver.

questions_en.question: You want to catch up during the traffic jam, is that allowed?
questions_en.feedback: You can never catch in a traffic jam all the way to the right or left. Also not on the emergency lane. This must happen through, between the cars.

questions_en.question: If you encounter this sign you must:
questions_en.feedback: This sign means that are some strong winds present, so hold your steering-wheel firmly.
options: Taking a longer braking distance into account.
Watch out because you will arrive at a bridge.
